technology.author: Pragya Swastik
technology.content: Google has begun rolling out 'passkeys' that lets users sign into their Google accounts without a password or 2-Step Verification. Passkeys enable users to securely sign in to their Google accounts using their fingerprint, face, screen lock, or hardware security key. "Unlike passwords, passkeys can only exist on your devices," Google said in a blog post.
technology.title: Google launches 'passkeys' for password-free sign-in

technology.author: Ankush Verma
technology.content: Cognizant will lay off 3,500 employees and also give up millions of square feet in office space to save costs, saying that its revenues will decline in 2023. The company will incur $200 million in employee severance and other costs, which it said is "primarily related to non-billable and corporate personnel, which we expect to mostly incur in 2023".
technology.title: Cognizant to lay off 3,500 employees

technology.author: Pragya Swastik
technology.content: 'Passkeys' let users sign in to their Google Account with fingerprint, face scan, or device screen lock, like a PIN. Unlike passwords, passkeys can only exist on your devices. "The main ingredient of passkeys is cryptographic private key – this is what is stored on your devices...When you create one, the corresponding public key is uploaded to Google," said Google.
technology.title: How does Google's password-free sign-in 'passkey' work?

technology.author: Pragya Swastik
technology.content: Mumbai Police have exposed a ring of cybercriminals that stole money from people by posing as police personnel and arrested its mastermind, a Class 12 passout. The 49-year-old mastermind Shrinivas Rao Dadi, who had been making up to ₹5 crore a day, was arrested from a hotel in Hyderabad, PTI reported. Police also arrested four members of his gang.
technology.title: Class 12 passout making ₹5 crore a day from cyber scams held from Hyderabad

technology.author: Pragya Swastik
technology.content: Google will be replacing the 'lock' icon in Chrome's address bar with a variant of the tune icon, which is commonly used to indicate controls and settings. "The lock icon is meant to indicate that the network connection is a secure channel between the browser," Google said. "But it's a remnant of an era where HTTPS was uncommon," it added.
technology.title: Google to replace iconic 'lock' icon in Chrome, shares pic of new icon

technology.author: Pragya Swastik
technology.content: IBM's CEO Arvind Krishna told Bloomberg that working remotely can hurt people's careers, especially those who are in managerial roles. "Being a people manager when you're remote is just tough because if you're managing people, you need to be able to see them once in a while," he said. "We work better when we're together in person," he added.
technology.title: Remote work can hurt your career: IBM CEO Arvind Krishna

technology.author: Pragya Swastik
technology.content: Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath warned of a scam after someone he knows lost ₹5 lakh. "It started with a response to a part-time job offer on WhatsApp," Kamath tweeted, adding that ₹30,000 was given to the person for fake reviews for resorts. The person was then added to a Telegram group and lured into trading on a mock crypto platform.
technology.title: Zerodha CEO explains a new part-time job scam after friend loses ₹5 lakh

technology.author: Mansi Agarwal
technology.content: Ford CEO Jim Farley on Wednesday said price cuts in the EV market is "a worrying trend". "The resale value for people who bought at higher prices is awful. They never forget," Farley stated. His comments came as Ford reduced price of its Mustang Mach-E electric vehicle by up to 8% following a series of price cuts by rival Tesla.
technology.title: Price cuts in EV market worrying trend: Ford CEO

technology.author: Nidhi Sinha
technology.content: Inflection AI, the startup founded by LinkedIn Co-founder Reid Hoffman and DeepMind Co-founder Mustafa Suleyman, has released its first AI chatbot product. The startup's chatbot, named Pi, is similar to ChatGPT and uses generative AI technology to interact with users through conversations. Users can interact with Pi across platforms, including its website and social media platforms like Instagram.
technology.title: LinkedIn Co-founder Reid Hoffman's startup launches 'Pi' chatbot

technology.author: Mansi Agarwal
technology.content: TikTok on Tuesday said its head of trust and safety for US data security, Eric Han, will leave the company on May 12. His departure comes as the company owned by China's ByteDance faces risk of getting banned in US over data privacy concerns. Recently, TikTok has been banned from government devices in multiple countries including Canada and UK.
technology.title: TikTok's US data security chief to leave amid calls for app ban

technology.author: Mansi Agarwal
technology.content: 'Godfather of AI' Geoffrey Hinton, who has left Google to talk about AI risks, said bad actors like Russian President Vladimir Putin can use AI tools to win wars or manipulate elections. In an interview with MIT Technology Review, Hinton said, "Don't think for a moment that Putin wouldn't make hyper-intelligent robots with the goal of killing Ukrainians."
technology.title: Putin can make hyper-intelligent robots to kill Ukrainians: Hinton

technology.author: Mansi Agarwal
technology.content: Microsoft Chief Economist Michael Schwarz said he's "confident" that AI will be used by bad actors and will cause "real damage". Schwarz, however, stated that AI regulation should be brought in once the technology causes "real harm". "The benefits from the regulation to our society should be greater than the cost," he added.
technology.title: AI will cause real damage: Microsoft Chief Economist

technology.author: Srishty Choudhury
technology.content: Meta said since March, it has found around 10 malware families and over 1,000 malicious links that were promoted as tools featuring ChatGPT. Meta uncovered malware purveyors leveraging public interest in ChatGPT to lure users into downloading malicious apps and browser extensions. Meta's Chief Information Security Officer Guy Rosen said that for bad actors, "ChatGPT is the new crypto".
technology.title: Meta detects 1,000 malicious links hosting ChatGPT-like malware

technology.author: Mansi Agarwal
technology.content: Andhra Pradesh CM YS Jagan Mohan Reddy on Wednesday laid foundation stone for ₹21,844 crore Vizag Tech Park. The park, which is being developed by Adani Group, will feature a 200 MW data centre in Madhurawada and a 100 MW data centre in Kapuluppada. Adani Group's MD Rajesh Adani and Adani Ports CEO Karan Adani were present during the ceremony.
technology.title: Andhra CM lays foundation stone for ₹21,844 cr Vizag Tech Park

technology.author: Ashley Paul
technology.content: Microsoft is planning to offer a privacy enhanced version of AI chatbot ChatGPT for businesses amid rising concerns over data security of users, The Information reported. Microsoft is reportedly planning to offer the variant on its Azure cloud platform. The new variant will run on dedicated servers where collected user data would be separated from the chatbot's publicly available variant.
technology.title: Microsoft tests ChatGPT alternative amid privacy concerns: Report

technology.author: Ashley Paul
technology.content: Artificial intelligence (AI) won't take jobs away but someone who knows how to use it might, economist Richard Baldwin said at World Economic Forum's Growth Summit. "AI is essentially wisdom in a can," he said. "The most talented workers are people who have 20 years of experience and know how to apply that. That's what AI does overnight," he added.
technology.title: Not AI, but someone using it may take jobs away: Economist Baldwin

technology.author: Aishwarya Awasthi
technology.content: US-based broadcaster NPR has said that Twitter owner Elon Musk "threatened" to reassign their Twitter handle to another firm or person. Musk had asked an NPR reporter about the firm's engagement with Twitter, the broadcaster claimed. "So is NPR going to start posting on Twitter again, or should we reassign @NPR to another company?" NPR quoted Musk as saying.
technology.title: Musk threatened to reassign our Twitter handle to other firm: NPR

technology.author: Aishwarya Awasthi
technology.content: Former Twitter India head Manish Maheshwari has written to Twitter owner Elon Musk listing five-point recommendations for the platform. In his letter, Maheshwari wrote that Twitter's latest verification policy changes hurt the digital reputation of prominent figures like Ratan Tata, Amitabh Bachchan and Priyanka Chopra. He added that damage has been done to the trust celebrities had in Twitter.
technology.title: Twitter's verification rule hit Tata's reputation: Ex-India head

technology.author: Mansi Agarwal
technology.content: Nathaniel Chastain, a former manager at world's largest NFT marketplace OpenSea, has been convicted of fraud and money laundering. Chastain used inside knowledge of which non-fungible tokens (NFTs) will feature on OpenSea's home page to make personal NFT trades and earn over $50,000 in profit. He had pleaded not guilty to the charges brought against him.
technology.title: World's largest NFT marketplace OpenSea ex-exec convicted of fraud

technology.author: Nidhi Sinha
technology.content: Twitter owner Elon Musk has stated that the microblogging platform's video upload is "bad". He tweeted, "Sorry our video upload is so bad! We're working on major improvements." He added, "I recommend 480p for video longer than 10 [minutes]...That resolution is fine for phone/laptop users." Further, he said videos posted natively to Twitter will be boosted more than external links.
technology.title: Sorry Twitter's video upload is bad, working on improvements: Musk

technology.author: Mansi Agarwal
technology.content: Meta in its latest transparency report said it took action against more than 38.4 million content pieces on Facebook and over 4.61 million content pieces on Instagram in India in March for policy violations. According to the report, Facebook received 7,193 reports through the Indian grievance mechanism, while Instagram received 9,226 reports during the month.
technology.title: Meta takes action against 43 mn content pieces in India in March

technology.author: Nidhi Sinha
technology.content: US scientists claimed they've found a way to use brain scans and artificial intelligence to transcribe the gist of human thoughts. For a study, three people spent 16 hours inside an fMRI machine, allowing researchers to map out how words and meanings prompted responses in their brains. This data was fed into a GPT-1 AI model to interpret participants' thoughts.
technology.title: Brain scans, AI used to decode human thoughts by US scientists

technology.author: Mansi Agarwal
technology.content: Meta in its latest adversarial threat report said it took action against about 120 accounts on Facebook and Instagram that were linked to a hacking group in Pakistan. These accounts targeted people in India, including Indian military personnel, Meta stated. The company said it also took action against India-based hacking group Patchwork, with which about 50 accounts were linked.
technology.title: Meta detects Pak hacking group that targeted Indian army personnel

technology.author: Nidhi Sinha
technology.content: Google CEO Sundar Pichai, Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella, OpenAI CEO Sam Altman and Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei have been invited to discuss key artificial intelligence issues at White House on Thursday, an official said. The invitation reportedly noted President Joe Biden's "expectation that companies like yours must make sure their products are safe before making them available to the public".
technology.title: Google, Microsoft CEOs called to AI meet at White House: Official

sports.author: Anmol Sharma
sports.content: Manchester City's 22-year-old forward Erling Haaland broke the record for scoring most goals in a single Premier League season on Wednesday night. Haaland took his tally of goals in Premier League 2022-23 to 35 with a 70th-minute goal against West Ham United. Andy Cole (Newcastle United, 1993-94) and Alan Shearer (Blackburn Rovers 1994-95) jointly held the previous record (34 goals).
sports.title: 22-year-old Haaland breaks record for scoring most goals in a single PL season

sports.author: Anmol Sharma
sports.content: Argentine forward Lionel Messi will leave PSG at the end of the season, as per reports. Messi's father Jorge had already communicated the decision to PSG one month ago, reports added. Messi was recently suspended by PSG for two weeks without pay due to an unauthorised trip to Saudi Arabia.
sports.title: Lionel Messi to leave PSG at end of season: Reports

sports.author: Anmol Sharma
sports.content: Referring to viral video of him helping the ground staff in Lucknow during rain, LSG fielding coach Jonty Rhodes tweeted that he was "actually inspired" by MS Dhoni and "the way he handled" the incredible support he was shown at Ekana Stadium. "Not just a legend, but a great man too," Rhodes further stated about Dhoni.
sports.title: I was inspired by Dhoni: Jonty Rhodes on viral video of him helping ground staff in rain

sports.author: Anmol Sharma
sports.content: Mumbai Indians (MI) recorded the highest successful run chase of IPL 2023 on Wednesday by chasing down a 215-run target against Punjab Kings (PBKS) in Mohali. MI chased down the target in 18.5 overs. Ishan Kishan top-scored for MI with 75(41), while Suryakumar Yadav scored 66(31).
sports.title: Mumbai Indians record highest successful run chase of IPL 2023

sports.author: Anmol Sharma
sports.content: MI's English pacer Jofra Archer on Wednesday gave away most runs in an over in his T20 career. The 28-year-old conceded 27 runs in his fourth over against PBKS today. PBKS' Livingstone slammed three sixes in a row in the over. Archer had conceded 22 runs in his previous most expensive over in a T20 match.
sports.title: Jofra Archer bowls most expensive over of his T20 career

sports.author: Anmol Sharma
sports.content: Mumbai Indians (MI) captain Rohit Sharma on Wednesday equalled the record for registering most ducks in IPL history. Rohit recorded his 15th duck in the match against Punjab Kings (PBKS) today. Dinesh Karthik, Sunil Narine and Mandeep Singh also have 15 ducks to their names in IPL.
sports.title: Rohit Sharma equals record for registering most ducks in IPL history

sports.author: Anmol Sharma
sports.content: MI trolled PBKS after defeating them on Wednesday. "To all police departments...Nothing to report here...We just played a game...in Mohali and a team was beaten here...You guys have important matters to take care of," MI tweeted. Earlier after Arshdeep Singh broke stumps in PBKS' win over MI in Mumbai, PBKS, tagging Mumbai Police, tweeted, "We'd like to report a crime."
sports.title: MI troll PBKS with tweet to 'all police departments' after win in Mohali

sports.author: Subhangi Singh
sports.content: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Thursday criticised the "manhandling" of protesting women wrestlers in Delhi's Jantar Mantar and called the alleged act by Delhi Police "shameful". Taking to Twitter, Rahul shared a video of women wrestlers crying and wrote, "Beti Bachao is just hypocrisy! In fact, BJP has never shied away from torturing the daughters of India."
sports.title: Beti Bachao is BJP's hypocrisy: Rahul on video of wrestlers crying

sports.author: Nakul Ahuja
sports.content: In a video that has surfaced online, students can be seen protesting in support of wrestlers at DU's North Campus. Section 144 was also imposed following the students' protest. One of the protesters said that the protest was being carried out due to the police's inaction against WFI chief Brij Bhushan Singh over allegations of sexual harassment by the wrestlers.
sports.title: Protest erupts in DU in support of wrestlers, section 144 imposed

sports.author: Shreyasi Banerjee
sports.content: The Supreme Court on Thursday closed the proceedings in the wrestlers' sexual harassment case, as the purpose of their plea, which was the registration of an FIR against WFI chief Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, was met by Delhi Police. "If petitioners wish for something else, they can approach the magistrate or the HC in its jurisdiction," CJI DY Chandrachud said.
sports.title: SC closes wrestlers' plea against WFI chief after noting FIR filed

sports.author: Anmol Sharma
sports.content: An alleged ruckus took place between protesting wrestlers and Delhi Police at Jantar Mantar on Wednesday. In a video that has surfaced online, wrestler Vinesh Phogat claimed that a police official smashed the head of a protester. She also claimed that Delhi Police verbally abused women wrestlers. The wrestlers have been protesting at Jantar Mantar since April 23.
sports.title: Ruckus takes place between wrestlers, Delhi Police at Jantar Mantar, video surfaces

sports.author: Anmol Sharma
sports.content: Former India all-rounder Irfan Pathan said that Gautam Gambhir played with the ego of MS Dhoni when he was the captain of KKR. "He was the only one who succeeded in rattling him for years," Irfan said. Referring to instance where Gambhir placed fielders close to Dhoni, Irfan stated, "MS was rattled to the core by the field setting."
sports.title: Gautam Gambhir played with ego of MS Dhoni when he was KKR captain: Irfan Pathan

sports.author: Sakshita Khosla
sports.content: A video has shown IOA President PT Usha being heckled by some supporters of the wrestlers' protest at Delhi's Jantar Mantar. Usha was seen moving away after being confronted by some protesters over her statement that the protesting wrestlers are "tarnishing India's image". Usha met the wrestlers on Wednesday and told them that her remarks were 'misquoted'.
sports.title: Video shows PT Usha being heckled over her remarks at wrestlers' protest site

sports.author: Anmol Sharma
sports.content: In an apparent dig at journalist Rajat Sharma for calling him jealous of Virat Kohli, Gautam Gambhir, in a cryptic tweet wrote, "Man who ran away from Delhi cricket citing 'pressure' seems overeager to sell paid PR as concern for cricket!" He added, "Yahi Kalyug hai jahan 'Bhagode' apni 'Adalat' chalate hain (This is Kalyug where 'fugitives' run their 'court')."
sports.title: Man who ran away from Delhi cricket seems overeager to sell paid PR, tweets Gambhir

sports.author: Arnab Mukherji
sports.content: Discussing MI batter Suryakumar Yadav's 66 off 31 balls against PBKS, ex-India spinner Harbhajan Singh said, "AB de Villiers, Chris Gayle played and went but [no] batter has dominated like this." "If so many runs are getting scored, come running and don't bowl the ball at all [to Suryakumar]. Let him keep searching where the ball has gone," added Harbhajan.
sports.title: Not even Gayle, De Villiers dominated like this: Harbhajan on SKY

sports.author: Subhangi Singh
sports.content: Reacting to scuffle between Delhi Police and protesting wrestlers at Delhi's Jantar Mantar, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee said that disrobing the honour of our daughters in this manner is "utterly shameful". "The fight is right and the fight will continue. Don't dare to hurt our wrestlers, the nation is watching their tears and nation won't forgive you," she added.
sports.title: Don't dare to hurt our wrestlers: Mamata on scuffle incident

sports.author: Subhangi Singh
sports.content: After scuffle broke out between Delhi Police and protesting wrestlers at Jantar Mantar on Wednesday night, Delhi Commission for Women (DCW) chief Swati Maliwal reached the protest site and said that she won't go without meeting wrestlers. "I have come to meet the girls since it is my statutory duty, I am not a terrorist to be stopped," she added.
sports.title: Won't leave protest site without meeting wrestlers: DCW chief

sports.author: Bhuvnesh Ojha
sports.content: Praising PBKS wicketkeeper-batter Jitesh Sharma for his performance in IPL 2023, former India cricketer Ravi Shastri said that Jitesh is the "find of the IPL". "Rishabh Pant is unfortunately not available but this guy can enter Team India anytime," Shastri stated. He added that Jitesh, who has scored 239 runs this year, is a "fearless" cricketer.
sports.title: Jitesh find of IPL, can play for India in Pant's absence: Shastri

sports.author: Subhangi Singh
sports.content: The Delhi Police on Thursday refuted claims of protesting wrestlers that its personnel were drunk and used force against them during a late-night scuffle at Jantar Mantar. The Deputy Commissioner of Police (DCP), New Delhi, claimed that five police personnel were injured during the scuffle. "A sufficient number of women officers were on duty," the DCP added.
sports.title: No force used against wrestlers, 5 policemen injured: Delhi Police

sports.author: Subhangi Singh
sports.content: Delhi Commission for Women (DCW) chief Swati Maliwal on Thursday accused Delhi Police of helping Wrestling Federation of India (WFI) chief Brij Bhushan Singh, saying she does not know why Delhi Police is trying to protect "goon" like him. She further accused Delhi Police of misbehaving with her while she tried to meet the protesting wrestlers at Jantar Mantar.
sports.title: Why Delhi Police is trying to protect goon like Bhushan?: Maliwal

sports.author: Athira Sasidharan
sports.content: Former Indian cricketer Virender Sehwag said that SunRisers Hyderabad (SRH) should not drop opening batter Mayank Agarwal for their remaining fixtures of the ongoing IPL 2023. "They don't have anyone who can replace him at the moment. They should give him some confidence. He could return to form and win one or two matches for SRH," Sehwag added.
sports.title: SRH don't have anyone who can replace Mayank Agarwal: Sehwag

sports.author: Subhangi Singh
sports.content: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Thursday criticised BJP after wrestlers alleged that Delhi Police abused and misbehaved with them, saying the "arrogant" BJP wants to run the entire system with "hooliganism". Sharing video of Vinesh Phogat and other wrestlers addressing media and crying, Kejriwal asked people of the country to "not only uproot the BJP but also drive them out."
sports.title: Time to drive BJP out: Kejriwal on video of wrestlers crying

sports.author: Athira Sasidharan
sports.content: RCB fast bowler Mohammed Siraj said, "Death over bowling is more entertaining than powerplay." "Everyone comes prepared to smack the bowler, so it's more challenging," he added. Speaking about the ongoing IPL season, Siraj said, "This season is going very well. I'm focused on my fitness and it is reflecting on my bowling. I can consistently bowl in same areas."
sports.title: Death overs are more entertaining than powerplay: Siraj

sports.author: Saurabh Sinha
sports.content: After Delhi Police claimed that AAP leader Somnath Bharti brought folding cots at wrestlers' protest site, wrestler Vinesh Phogat said that it was they who procured the "beds". "Even if Bharti brought it, or let's say the Prime Minister sent it, don't we have the right to sleep?" Phogat asked. "Was it a bomb or a weapon?" she asked.
sports.title: Don't we have right to sleep: Vinesh after cots reach protest site

sports.author: Bhuvnesh Ojha
sports.content: Former India cricketer Sunil Gavaskar has said that CSK captain MS Dhoni can become Team India's coach "a little bit later". "I do believe that you need a little bit of cooling-off period before you take any assignment with the team," Gavaskar stated. Dhoni was the mentor of Team India in T20 World Cup 2021.
sports.title: MS Dhoni can become Team India's coach little bit later: Gavaskar

all.author: Swati Dubey
all.content: The Congress party has won majority of seats in the Shimla Municipal Corporation election after 10 years. It has claimed 24 out of 34 total seats in the election. The BJP secured nine seats, while the Communist Party of India (CPM) won the seat only in one ward. The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) failed to win any of the seats.
all.title: Congress wins Shimla MC polls after 10 yrs with 24 seats, BJP at 9

all.author: Pragya Swastik
all.content: Archaeologists have discovered the remains of a 19th-century quarantine hospital and cemetery submerged in the waters off the Dry Tortugas National Park in the Florida Keys. The hospital on a now-submerged island was used to treat yellow fever patients at the fort between 1890 and 1900. A headstone from 1861, part of the Fort Jefferson Post Cemetery, was also found.
all.title: 19th-century hospital, cemetery found underwater in US

all.author: Anmol Sharma
all.content: Referring to viral video of him helping the ground staff in Lucknow during rain, LSG fielding coach Jonty Rhodes tweeted that he was "actually inspired" by MS Dhoni and "the way he handled" the incredible support he was shown at Ekana Stadium. "Not just a legend, but a great man too," Rhodes further stated about Dhoni.
all.title: I was inspired by Dhoni: Jonty Rhodes on viral video of him helping ground staff in rain

all.author: Shreyasi Banerjee
all.content: The Supreme Court on Thursday closed the proceedings in the wrestlers' sexual harassment case, as the purpose of their plea, which was the registration of an FIR against WFI chief Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, was met by Delhi Police. "If petitioners wish for something else, they can approach the magistrate or the HC in its jurisdiction," CJI DY Chandrachud said.
all.title: SC closes wrestlers' plea against WFI chief after noting FIR filed

all.author: Pragya Swastik
all.content: IBM's CEO Arvind Krishna told Bloomberg that working remotely can hurt people's careers, especially those who are in managerial roles. "Being a people manager when you're remote is just tough because if you're managing people, you need to be able to see them once in a while," he said. "We work better when we're together in person," he added.
all.title: Remote work can hurt your career: IBM CEO Arvind Krishna

all.author: Nakul Ahuja
all.content: A committee formed by former NCP chief Sharad Pawar will decide the next party chief on May 5, Friday, a senior NCP leader said on Thursday. The meeting will take place at 11 am at the party office in Mumbai, the leader said. Sharad Pawar resigned on Tuesday, however, party workers have requested him to reconsider his decision.
all.title: NCP to decide next chief on May 5 following Pawar's resignation

all.author: Shreyasi Banerjee
all.content: As many as 22 children fell unconscious during the birthday celebration of a teacher in a school in south Delhi, police said. Initial investigation has revealed that the incident happened after a pepper spray went off after it was mistaken for a deodorant, an officer said. The unconscious students were rushed to Safdarjung Hospital, where they've been kept under observation.
all.title: 22 children faint after pepper spray goes off at Delhi school

all.author: Sakshita Khosla
all.content: A dreaded gangster named Anil Dujana was killed in an encounter by the UP Special Task Force (STF) in Meerut, reports said on Thursday. The gangster was a resident of Dujana village of UP's Gautam Buddha Nagar. Earlier in April, gangster Atiq Ahmed's son Asad and his aide were encountered by the state STF in UP's Jhansi district.
all.title: Gangster Anil Dujana killed in police encounter in UP's Meerut

all.author: Swati Dubey
all.content: Nearly 15,000 doctors from government hospitals in Madhya Pradesh ended their indefinite strike after the High Court termed it 'illegal' on Wednesday. The doctors were demanding facilities for their rural colleagues and an end to bureaucratic interference. The court ruled that the doctors cannot go on strike without seeking permission, as a PIL on the matter is pending.
all.title: 15,000 MP doctors call off strike as High Court terms it illegal

all.author: Kameshwari
all.content: Shark Tank India's Anupam Mittal recalled watching Ram Gopal Varma's 'Aag' with Amitabh Bachchan and the filmmaker. "I could see Mr Bachchan had absolutely zero expression on his face. I think he knew it [was bad]. But it's okay, it's creative work. Nobody starts out wanting to make...flop," Mittal said in an interview. The 2007 film also starred Mohanlal.
all.title: He had zero expression: Anupam Mittal on watching 'Aag' with Big B

all.author: Arnab Mukherji
all.content: Discussing MI batter Suryakumar Yadav's 66 off 31 balls against PBKS, ex-India spinner Harbhajan Singh said, "AB de Villiers, Chris Gayle played and went but [no] batter has dominated like this." "If so many runs are getting scored, come running and don't bowl the ball at all [to Suryakumar]. Let him keep searching where the ball has gone," added Harbhajan.
all.title: Not even Gayle, De Villiers dominated like this: Harbhajan on SKY

all.author: Athira Sasidharan
all.content: Former Indian cricketer Virender Sehwag said that SunRisers Hyderabad (SRH) should not drop opening batter Mayank Agarwal for their remaining fixtures of the ongoing IPL 2023. "They don't have anyone who can replace him at the moment. They should give him some confidence. He could return to form and win one or two matches for SRH," Sehwag added.
all.title: SRH don't have anyone who can replace Mayank Agarwal: Sehwag

all.author: Saurabh Sinha
all.content: After Delhi Police claimed that AAP leader Somnath Bharti brought folding cots at wrestlers' protest site, wrestler Vinesh Phogat said that it was they who procured the "beds". "Even if Bharti brought it, or let's say the Prime Minister sent it, don't we have the right to sleep?" Phogat asked. "Was it a bomb or a weapon?" she asked.
all.title: Don't we have right to sleep: Vinesh after cots reach protest site

all.author: Subhangi Singh
all.content: The Delhi Police on Thursday refuted claims of protesting wrestlers that its personnel were drunk and used force against them during a late-night scuffle at Jantar Mantar. The Deputy Commissioner of Police (DCP), New Delhi, claimed that five police personnel were injured during the scuffle. "A sufficient number of women officers were on duty," the DCP added.
all.title: No force used against wrestlers, 5 policemen injured: Delhi Police

all.author: Mansi Agarwal
all.content: Nathaniel Chastain, a former manager at world's largest NFT marketplace OpenSea, has been convicted of fraud and money laundering. Chastain used inside knowledge of which non-fungible tokens (NFTs) will feature on OpenSea's home page to make personal NFT trades and earn over $50,000 in profit. He had pleaded not guilty to the charges brought against him.
all.title: World's largest NFT marketplace OpenSea ex-exec convicted of fraud

all.author: Bhuvnesh Ojha
all.content: Talking about "discredited" politicians visiting Delhi's Jantar Mantar, Union Minister Meenakashi Lekhi said their visits have eroded the credibility of the ongoing wrestlers' protest. "When politicians facing ED action and corruption charges reach...dharna site, the credibility of the protest is eroded," Lekhi stated. She added the AAP government is using the protest as a "diversionary" tactic.
all.title: Discredited leaders erode wrestlers' protest's credibility: Lekhi

all.author: Apoorva Shankar
all.content:
Police on Wednesday claimed to have recovered an unlicensed pistol and cartridges from the residence of a lawyer of now slain former MP Atiq Ahmed in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj. 
Three cellphones were also confiscated from the house of Khan Shoulat Hanif. Hanif has been lodged at a jail in Prayagraj since March following his conviction in kidnapping of Umesh Pal.
all.title: Unlicensed pistol seized from Atiq's lawyer's house in UP: Police

all.author: Swati Dubey
all.content: A 45-year-old man died after falling off the terrace while being chased by monkeys in Uttar Pradesh's Niranjan Nagla village. The monkeys were attracted to the terrace by food served for a marriage ceremony in the courtyard of the victim's neighbour. Police arrived at the scene and sent his body for post-mortem.
all.title: Monkeys chase 45-year-old man to death in Uttar Pradesh

all.author: Bhuvnesh Ojha
all.content: A video showing President Droupadi Murmu greeting people after returning to her home in Odisha nearly a year after becoming the head of the state has surfaced online. Although a carcade was kept ready to take her away directly from the helipad, she chose to walk down a distance, greeting people waiting for hours on both sides of the road.
all.title: Murmu returns home nearly a year after becoming Prez, video out

all.author: Bhawana Chaudhary
all.content: Sri Lankan government has decided to introduce "baby boxes" for parents to leave unwanted newborns. Parents who are unwilling to raise the children can anonymously leave the infants for the state to take care of them. Department of Probation and Child Care Services said over 60 cases of parents abandoning children on streets have been reported in recent years.
all.title: Sri Lanka to introduce 'baby boxes' to leave unwanted newborns

all.author: Athira Sasidharan
all.content: Police have released a video showing a speeding BMW car in US crashing into another vehicle and a policeman, who was conducting a traffic stop on a highway. The BMW was being driven by a 17-year-old teen at 120 mph. "The officer was...nearly killed [in the accident]," police said. The teen, who sustained minor injuries, was charged with reckless driving.
all.title: US teen loses control of BMW, hits policeman; video surfaces

all.author: Srishty Choudhury
all.content: The share price of Adani Enterprises rose by up to 4% on Thursday to touch ₹1,912.7/share ahead of the earnings results announcement for the fourth quarter ended March. Adani Enterprises shares are still about 45.3% lower than that prior to the impact of the Hindenburg report published on January 24, and down about 55% from the 52-week high of ₹4,190/share.
all.title: Adani Enterprises' stock price rises up to 4% ahead of Q4 results

all.author: Aishwarya Awasthi
all.content: US engine maker Pratt & Whitney is struggling to support Airbus' fleet of passenger jets with enough spare parts and engines, the planemaker said on Wednesday. Airbus CEO Guillaume Faury has declined to comment on Go First filing for bankruptcy in India. Go First has blamed Pratt & Whitney for faulty engines and the non-supply of engines.
all.title: Pratt & Whitney struggling to support jets with engines: Airbus

all.author: Aishwarya Awasthi
all.content: Adani Ports and Special Economic Zone has concluded the sale of the Myanmar Port for $30 million. APSEZ announced the signing of a Share Purchase Agreement for the port's sale in May 2022. The firm had originally aimed to complete its exit between March 2022-June 2022. However, delays led to APSEZ renegotiating the sale price with the buyer Solar Energy.
all.title: Adani Ports and SEZ sells Myanmar Port for $30 million

all.author: Srishty Choudhury
all.content: Amid concerns about a hike in airfares as a consequence of Go First filing for insolvency, SpiceJet CEO Ajay Singh said, "Those are temporary phenomena." "When there is a mismatch of supply and demand...airfares will go up," Singh added. He said there's need for "more rational airfares" in the country and hoped fares will be more rational in coming times.
all.title: Temporary phenomena: SpiceJet CEO on fare hike amid Go First issue

national.author: Swati Dubey
national.content: The Congress party has won majority of seats in the Shimla Municipal Corporation election after 10 years. It has claimed 24 out of 34 total seats in the election. The BJP secured nine seats, while the Communist Party of India (CPM) won the seat only in one ward. The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) failed to win any of the seats.
national.title: Congress wins Shimla MC polls after 10 yrs with 24 seats, BJP at 9

national.author: Shreyasi Banerjee
national.content: The Patna High Court on Thursday put an interim stay on the caste-based census in Bihar. In the hearing, advocate Dinu Kumar, on behalf of petitioners, said the right to conduct surveys is beyond the state government's jurisdiction. Advocate General PK Shahi, on behalf of the state, said the survey is being conducted to make plans for public welfare.
national.title: Patna High Court puts interim stay on caste-based census in Bihar

national.author: Shreyasi Banerjee
national.content: The Supreme Court on Thursday closed the proceedings in the wrestlers' sexual harassment case, as the purpose of their plea, which was the registration of an FIR against WFI chief Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, was met by Delhi Police. "If petitioners wish for something else, they can approach the magistrate or the HC in its jurisdiction," CJI DY Chandrachud said.
national.title: SC closes wrestlers' plea against WFI chief after noting FIR filed

national.author: Subhangi Singh
national.content: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Thursday criticised the "manhandling" of protesting women wrestlers in Delhi's Jantar Mantar and called the alleged act by Delhi Police "shameful". Taking to Twitter, Rahul shared a video of women wrestlers crying and wrote, "Beti Bachao is just hypocrisy! In fact, BJP has never shied away from torturing the daughters of India."
national.title: Beti Bachao is BJP's hypocrisy: Rahul on video of wrestlers crying

national.author: Sakshita Khosla
national.content: A video has shown IOA President PT Usha being heckled by some supporters of the wrestlers' protest at Delhi's Jantar Mantar. Usha was seen moving away after being confronted by some protesters over her statement that the protesting wrestlers are "tarnishing India's image". Usha met the wrestlers on Wednesday and told them that her remarks were 'misquoted'.
national.title: Video shows PT Usha being heckled over her remarks at wrestlers' protest site

national.author: Nakul Ahuja
national.content: A committee formed by former NCP chief Sharad Pawar will decide the next party chief on May 5, Friday, a senior NCP leader said on Thursday. The meeting will take place at 11 am at the party office in Mumbai, the leader said. Sharad Pawar resigned on Tuesday, however, party workers have requested him to reconsider his decision.
national.title: NCP to decide next chief on May 5 following Pawar's resignation

national.author: Sakshita Khosla
national.content: A dreaded gangster named Anil Dujana was killed in an encounter by the UP Special Task Force (STF) in Meerut, reports said on Thursday. The gangster was a resident of Dujana village of UP's Gautam Buddha Nagar. Earlier in April, gangster Atiq Ahmed's son Asad and his aide were encountered by the state STF in UP's Jhansi district.
national.title: Gangster Anil Dujana killed in police encounter in UP's Meerut

national.author: Saurabh Sinha
national.content: The POCSO Act is not meant to punish minors in romantic or consensual relationships and brand them as criminals, the Bombay High Court said. It granted bail to a 25-year-old man accused of sexually assaulting a minor girl. The court noted that the accused, who was 22 at the time of incident, was in a consensual relationship with the girl.
national.title: POCSO Act not meant to punish minors in romantic relationships: HC

national.author: Shreyasi Banerjee
national.content: The Indian Army and Assam Rifles personnel have rescued around 9,000 civilians from violence-hit Manipur, following violent clashes and arson against the inclusion of the non-tribal Meitei community in the ST category. The relief and rescue operation continued through the night. "All possible assistance being rendered...to provide help to the population rescued," the Indian Army stated.
national.title: Army rescues 9,000 people in night operation amid Manipur violence

national.author: Shreyasi Banerjee
national.content: As many as 22 children fell unconscious during the birthday celebration of a teacher in a school in south Delhi, police said. Initial investigation has revealed that the incident happened after a pepper spray went off after it was mistaken for a deodorant, an officer said. The unconscious students were rushed to Safdarjung Hospital, where they've been kept under observation.
national.title: 22 children faint after pepper spray goes off at Delhi school

national.author: Swati Dubey
national.content: Nearly 15,000 doctors from government hospitals in Madhya Pradesh ended their indefinite strike after the High Court termed it 'illegal' on Wednesday. The doctors were demanding facilities for their rural colleagues and an end to bureaucratic interference. The court ruled that the doctors cannot go on strike without seeking permission, as a PIL on the matter is pending.
national.title: 15,000 MP doctors call off strike as High Court terms it illegal

national.author: Sakshita Khosla
national.content: The demand for ST status for the non-tribal Meitei community and the alleged eviction of people from tribal settlements have led to violent clashes and protests in the state of Manipur. The Manipur High Court in April ordered the state to consider the Meiteis' request for ST status. Additionally, tribals have protested the designation of tribal areas as protected forests.
national.title: What caused protests & violent clashes in Manipur?

national.author: Subhangi Singh
national.content: Reacting to scuffle between Delhi Police and protesting wrestlers at Delhi's Jantar Mantar, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee said that disrobing the honour of our daughters in this manner is "utterly shameful". "The fight is right and the fight will continue. Don't dare to hurt our wrestlers, the nation is watching their tears and nation won't forgive you," she added.
national.title: Don't dare to hurt our wrestlers: Mamata on scuffle incident

national.author: Subhangi Singh
national.content: The Delhi Police on Thursday refuted claims of protesting wrestlers that its personnel were drunk and used force against them during a late-night scuffle at Jantar Mantar. The Deputy Commissioner of Police (DCP), New Delhi, claimed that five police personnel were injured during the scuffle. "A sufficient number of women officers were on duty," the DCP added.
national.title: No force used against wrestlers, 5 policemen injured: Delhi Police

national.author: Saurabh Sinha
national.content: After Delhi Police claimed that AAP leader Somnath Bharti brought folding cots at wrestlers' protest site, wrestler Vinesh Phogat said that it was they who procured the "beds". "Even if Bharti brought it, or let's say the Prime Minister sent it, don't we have the right to sleep?" Phogat asked. "Was it a bomb or a weapon?" she asked.
national.title: Don't we have right to sleep: Vinesh after cots reach protest site

national.author: Bhuvnesh Ojha
national.content: Union Minister Meenakashi Lekhi has said AAP spent ₹45 crore on the renovation of Delhi CM's residence when Delhi was suffering from "food, sanitiser and mask shortages". She stated when people weren't allowed to leave home due to COVID-19, construction work was being carried out at CM's house. Lekhi added there was a "scam" in the renovation of the house.
national.title: When Delhi had food shortage, AAP spent ₹45 cr on CM's house: BJP

national.author: Nakul Ahuja
national.content: In the second part of his autobiography, former NCP chief Sharad Pawar mentioned his driver 'Gama', who has been taking him to various parts of Maharashtra for the last 43 years. "Gama is at times my guardian as well. He takes all the necessary care, including about my clothes, travel items, medicines and diet," Pawar said in his book.
national.title: Driver of 43 yrs my guardian, takes care of meds & clothes: Pawar

national.author: Nidhi Sinha
national.content: Nobel laureate Amartya Sen has moved the Calcutta High Court against Visva-Bharati's eviction notice. The university has asked him to vacate 13 decimal of land at his ancestral residence in Santiniketan by May 6. In his petition, Sen argued that in October 1943, Visva-Bharati had given 1.38 acres of land for a lease of 99 years to his father.
national.title: Amartya Sen moves Calcutta HC over Visva-Bharati's eviction order

national.author: Nidhi Sinha
national.content: Pakistan Foreign Minister Bilawal Bhutto posted a video message before landing in India for the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO) meeting in Goa. "I'm going to Goa today...My presence will show how important SCO is for Pakistan and how seriously it takes its membership," he said. Further, he tweeted, "I look forward to constructive discussions with my counterparts from friendly countries."
national.title: I look forward to constructive talks: Bilawal on SCO meet in Goa

national.author: Bhuvnesh Ojha
national.content: A video showing President Droupadi Murmu greeting people after returning to her home in Odisha nearly a year after becoming the head of the state has surfaced online. Although a carcade was kept ready to take her away directly from the helipad, she chose to walk down a distance, greeting people waiting for hours on both sides of the road.
national.title: Murmu returns home nearly a year after becoming Prez, video out

national.author: Swati Dubey
national.content: A 45-year-old man died after falling off the terrace while being chased by monkeys in Uttar Pradesh's Niranjan Nagla village. The monkeys were attracted to the terrace by food served for a marriage ceremony in the courtyard of the victim's neighbour. Police arrived at the scene and sent his body for post-mortem.
national.title: Monkeys chase 45-year-old man to death in Uttar Pradesh

national.author: Nidhi Sinha
national.content: A nine-year-old girl suffered burns and skull fracture after allegedly being beaten by her father, who also threw hot milk on her at their rented accommodation in Gurugram. The man is also accused of beating his wife. The wife said her father had earlier alerted police, but the police struck a deal with her husband and closed the case.
national.title: Man beats wife, throws hot milk on 9-year-old daughter in Gurugram

national.author: Apoorva Shankar
national.content:
Police on Wednesday claimed to have recovered an unlicensed pistol and cartridges from the residence of a lawyer of now slain former MP Atiq Ahmed in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj. 
Three cellphones were also confiscated from the house of Khan Shoulat Hanif. Hanif has been lodged at a jail in Prayagraj since March following his conviction in kidnapping of Umesh Pal.
national.title: Unlicensed pistol seized from Atiq's lawyer's house in UP: Police

national.author: Bhuvnesh Ojha
national.content: Talking about "discredited" politicians visiting Delhi's Jantar Mantar, Union Minister Meenakashi Lekhi said their visits have eroded the credibility of the ongoing wrestlers' protest. "When politicians facing ED action and corruption charges reach...dharna site, the credibility of the protest is eroded," Lekhi stated. She added the AAP government is using the protest as a "diversionary" tactic.
national.title: Discredited leaders erode wrestlers' protest's credibility: Lekhi

national.author: Nakul Ahuja
national.content: A 15-year-old Class 9 girl was allegedly abducted and gang-raped by three minors at an abandoned house in UP, police said. According to a complaint filed by the victim's uncle, the incident took place when she had gone to discard cow manure. The accused raped her and threatened to kill her if she informed anyone, police added.
national.title: Class 9 girl abducted, raped by 3 minors at abandoned house in UP

business.author: Ankush Verma
business.content: Go First on Thursday said, "We regret to inform that due to operational reasons, Go First flights scheduled till 9th May 2023 have been cancelled." "We apologise for the inconvenience caused by the flight cancellations. A full refund will be issued to the original mode of payment shortly," it further said.
business.title: Go First cancels all flights till May 9, promises full refund

business.author: Pragya Swastik
business.content: The World Bank on Wednesday confirmed Indian-origin Ajay Banga has been selected as its next President for a five-year term. "The Board looks forward to working with Mr. Banga on the World Bank Group Evolution process," the bank said in a statement. Former Mastercard CEO Ajay Banga, 63, will take over the role from David Malpass on June 2.
business.title: Indian-origin Ajay Banga confirmed as next World Bank President

business.author: Pragya Swastik
business.content: Indian-origin Ajay Banga will take over as World Bank's President on June 2. The 63-year-old Pune native studied economics at St Stephen's College, Delhi University and completed his further education at IIM Ahmedabad. He worked for companies like PepsiCo, Citigroup and joined General Atlantic after spending 12 years at Mastercard, including more than a decade as Mastercard's President and CEO.
business.title: Who is Ajay Banga, the next World Bank President?

business.author: Ankush Verma
business.content: After it filed for bankruptcy, Go First has suspended sale of their flight tickets till May 15, 2023, the Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) has said. The DGCA added that it has examined Go First's response to its show cause notice and has issued an order under the prevailing regulations directing them to process the refunds to passengers.
business.title: Go First told to issue refunds, suspends sale of flight tickets till May 15

business.author: Pragya Swastik
business.content: IBM's CEO Arvind Krishna told Bloomberg that working remotely can hurt people's careers, especially those who are in managerial roles. "Being a people manager when you're remote is just tough because if you're managing people, you need to be able to see them once in a while," he said. "We work better when we're together in person," he added.
business.title: Remote work can hurt your career: IBM CEO Arvind Krishna

business.author: Ankush Verma
business.content: Cognizant will lay off 3,500 employees and also give up millions of square feet in office space to save costs, saying that its revenues will decline in 2023. The company will incur $200 million in employee severance and other costs, which it said is "primarily related to non-billable and corporate personnel, which we expect to mostly incur in 2023".
business.title: Cognizant to lay off 3,500 employees

business.author: Pragya Swastik
business.content: The US Federal Reserve System on Wednesday raised its benchmark interest rate by 25 bps to a 16-year high. The 10th consecutive rate rise lifts the Fed's benchmark overnight interest rate to the 5.00%-5.25% range. This comes after the US inflation slowed in March, with consumer prices rising 4.2% as compared to the same month a year ago.
business.title: US Fed hikes key interest rates by 25 bps to 16-year high

business.author: Srishty Choudhury
business.content: Edible oil makers Adani Wilmar and Mother Dairy said the retail prices have been brought down by up to ₹20/litre in May. The packs with new prices are expected to hit stores in the next seven-10 days. "The maximum retail price of Dhara edible oils are being reduced by ₹15-20/litre across variants, with immediate effect," a Mother Dairy spokesperson said.
business.title: Adani Wilmar, Mother Dairy cut edible oil rates by up to ₹20/litre

business.author: Mansi Agarwal
business.content: Ford CEO Jim Farley on Wednesday said price cuts in the EV market is "a worrying trend". "The resale value for people who bought at higher prices is awful. They never forget," Farley stated. His comments came as Ford reduced price of its Mustang Mach-E electric vehicle by up to 8% following a series of price cuts by rival Tesla.
business.title: Price cuts in EV market worrying trend: Ford CEO

business.author: Srishty Choudhury
business.content: The Chinese-owned Volvo Cars of Sweden said in an effort to cut costs, it would slash 1,300 white-collar positions from its operations in Sweden. CEO Jim Rowan said that cost-cutting measures taken last year had started to "bear results" but that "it's clear that we need to do more...Economic headwinds, increased raw material prices are likely to remain a challenge".
business.title: Volvo Cars to slash 1,300 white-collar jobs to cut costs in Sweden

business.author: Srishty Choudhury
business.content: India's green financing requirement is estimated to be at least 2.5% of GDP annually till 2030, an RBI report said. The report covers areas like the unprecedented scale and pace of climate change, its macroeconomic effects, implications for financial stability and policy options to mitigate climate risks. India aims to achieve net zero emissions target by 2070.
business.title: India's green fund requirement estimated at 2.5% of GDP: RBI study

business.author: Aishwarya Awasthi
business.content: Adani Ports and Special Economic Zone has concluded the sale of the Myanmar Port for $30 million. APSEZ announced the signing of a Share Purchase Agreement for the port's sale in May 2022. The firm had originally aimed to complete its exit between March 2022-June 2022. However, delays led to APSEZ renegotiating the sale price with the buyer Solar Energy.
business.title: Adani Ports and SEZ sells Myanmar Port for $30 million

business.author: Ashley Paul
business.content: Target CEO Brian Cornell's total pay, including perks and benefits, was $17.6 million in 2022, 680 times the salary a median Target employee received, according to the company's proxy filing. This is despite Cornell getting a pay cut in 2022. Cornell's pay ratio was reportedly over double the average S&P 500 CEO's, who made 324 times their firm's average worker.
business.title: Target CEO got 680 times median staff's pay in 2022 after pay cut

business.author: Ashley Paul
business.content: TVS Motor has fully complied with all regulations specified under Centre's Faster Adoption and Manufacturing of Electric Vehicles (FAME) scheme, CEO KN Radhakrishnan said. "TVS Motor will offer a goodwill benefit scheme for its customers who've paid over and above the FAME threshold," Radhakrishnan said. Overall impact of this on TVS Motor will be less than ₹20 crore, he added.
business.title: TVS Motor has complied with all regulations under FAME scheme: CEO

business.author: Srishty Choudhury
business.content: Amid concerns about a hike in airfares as a consequence of Go First filing for insolvency, SpiceJet CEO Ajay Singh said, "Those are temporary phenomena." "When there is a mismatch of supply and demand...airfares will go up," Singh added. He said there's need for "more rational airfares" in the country and hoped fares will be more rational in coming times.
business.title: Temporary phenomena: SpiceJet CEO on fare hike amid Go First issue

business.author: Aishwarya Awasthi
business.content: US engine maker Pratt & Whitney is struggling to support Airbus' fleet of passenger jets with enough spare parts and engines, the planemaker said on Wednesday. Airbus CEO Guillaume Faury has declined to comment on Go First filing for bankruptcy in India. Go First has blamed Pratt & Whitney for faulty engines and the non-supply of engines.
business.title: Pratt & Whitney struggling to support jets with engines: Airbus

business.author: Mansi Agarwal
business.content: Amazon and Samara Capital are planning to sell 15-20% stake in More Retail for around $2 billion, The Economic Times reported. This comes as the retail chain is reportedly planning to go public in the next 12-18 months. More Retail was bought by both companies from the Aditya Birla Group in 2019 for a reported value of around $600 million.
business.title: Amazon, Samara may sell 20% stake in More Retail for $2 bn: Report

business.author: Srishty Choudhury
business.content: Estee Lauder's shares on Wednesday fell 20% to a six-month low of $196 in early trade after the company cited a slower-than-expected recovery in Asia travel retail and China for the latest round of cuts to its annual forecasts. However, European peers LVMH and L'Oreal saw a rise in first-quarter sales boosted by rebound in demand in the Chinese region.
business.title: Estee Lauder shares fall 20% to 6-month low on slow Asia retail

business.author: Aishwarya Awasthi
business.content: US billionaire Carl Icahn's investment firm Icahn Enterprises' shares lost nearly a fifth of their value on Wednesday, a day after Hindenburg's report on the firm. Since the release of the report yesterday, $7.5 billion has been wiped off Icahn's fortune, as per Forbes. Icahn Enterprises stock has lost 39% since the end of 2022.
business.title: Icahn's firm shares lose 5th of their value post Hindenburg report

business.author: Srishty Choudhury
business.content: International Monetary Fund (IMD) MD Kristalina Georgieva recently stated that the US dollar is gradually losing its status as the world's main reserve currency amid US-led anti-Russia sanctions. However, she also pointed out that although there is no viable alternative to the US dollar among global currencies in the near future, there has been a gradual shift away from it.
business.title: USD slowly losing status as world's main reserve currency: IMD MD

business.author: Srishty Choudhury
business.content: NTPC marked its first overseas power plant capacity addition in Bangladesh named Maitree Super Thermal Power Plant (MSTPP). The project will have two units of 660 MW each. The project was executed in collaboration with the Bangladesh-India Friendship Power Company, a foreign joint venture company of NTPC. With this new addition, NTPC's installed capacity has gone up to 72,304 MW.
business.title: NTPC starts first overseas power plant capacity in Bangladesh

business.author: Ashley Paul
business.content: Two-wheeler makers have informed that they'll reimburse 100% of portable charger cost to customers, CNBC TV18 reported. A total of 95,000 Ather customers will be reimbursed ₹140 crore, one lakh Ola Electric customers will be reimbursed ₹130 crore and 1,100 Hero MotoCorp customers will be reimbursed ₹2.23 crore. The firms had charged customers above threshold of Centre's FAME subsidy scheme.
business.title: 2-wheeler firms to reimburse ₹288 cr over subsidy misuse: Report

business.author: Aishwarya Awasthi
business.content: Google has leased over 1,00,000 square feet of office space in Pune in a commercial tower for three years, CRE Matrix reported. It has rented two units located on the 11th floor, for a starting monthly rent of ₹1.60 crore, and one unit on the 12th floor at ₹91.82 lakh/month. Google has paid a security deposit of ₹7.57 crore.
business.title: Google rents 1 lakh sq ft of space in Pune for 3 yrs: Report

business.author: Ashley Paul
business.content: Shah Dhandharia and Co LLP, who was flagged as a "tiny firm" with no website in Hindenburg Research's January report, has resigned as  Adani Total Gas' statutory auditor. The firm said it resigned due to "increased professional pre-occupation in other assignment". "Historical archives of [Shah Dhandharia's] website show that it had only four partners and 11 employees," Hindenburg had said.
business.title: Adani Total Gas' auditor, flagged in Hindenburg report, resigns

business.author: Srishty Choudhury
business.content: The share price of Adani Enterprises rose by up to 4% on Thursday to touch ₹1,912.7/share ahead of the earnings results announcement for the fourth quarter ended March. Adani Enterprises shares are still about 45.3% lower than that prior to the impact of the Hindenburg report published on January 24, and down about 55% from the 52-week high of ₹4,190/share.
business.title: Adani Enterprises' stock price rises up to 4% ahead of Q4 results

world.author: Ankush Verma
world.content: After the alleged attempt by Ukraine to assassinate Russian President Vladimir Putin, Deputy Chairman of Russia's Security Council, Dmitry Medvedev, said, "After today's terrorist attack, there are no options left other than physical elimination of Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy and his clique." Russia earlier said there was no material damage to the buildings and Putin wasn't injured.
world.title: No option left other than elimination of Zelenskyy: Russia after Putin assassination bid

world.author: Ankush Verma
world.content: Turkish pop singer Gulsen was handed a 10-month suspended sentence for "inciting hatred and enmity" over a joke about the country's religious schools. Gulsen was briefly jailed last year for the joke which she had made during a concert. She had said that the "perversion" of one of her musicians came from attending a religious school.
world.title: Turkish singer Gulsen sentenced over her mid-concert joke on religious schools

world.author: Sakshita Khosla
world.content: McDonald's was fined £500,000 (around ₹5 crore) after a customer found mouse droppings in their cheeseburger bought from an outlet in London. The unnamed customer had found rodent excrement on the inside of their burger wrapper. A mouse infestation was consequently uncovered at the restaurant in Leytonstone, which was closed after an investigation by authorities.
world.title: McDonald's fined ₹5 crore after mouse droppings found in burger in London

world.author: Sakshita Khosla
world.content: Former US President Donald Trump's lawsuit against The New York Times (NYT) has been dismissed and the judge ordered him to pay all legal fees and costs of the media outlet. Trump had filed a $100 million lawsuit against NYT over an award-winning expose on his taxes. The report said Trump's real estate business claimed low valuations on properties.
world.title: Donald Trump's $100 million lawsuit against The New York Times dismissed

world.author: Athira Sasidharan
world.content: Russia on Wednesday opened a terrorism probe after Moscow said it shot down two drones aimed at Russian President Vladimir Putin's residence and accused Ukraine of assassination attempt. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said Kyiv had nothing to do with the reported drone incident. "We don't attack Putin, or Moscow, we fight on our territory," Zelenskyy said.
world.title: Russia opens terrorism probe after attack 'aimed' at Putin's house

world.author: Ankush Verma
world.content: King Charles is the monarch of 14 Commonwealth realms in addition to the UK. The countries include Antigua and Barbuda, Australia, Bahamas, Belize, Canada, Grenada, Jamaica, New Zealand, Papua New Guinea, Saint Kitts and Nevis, Saint Lucia, Saint Vincent and the Grenadines, Solomon Islands and Tuvalu. King Charles' coronation will take place on May 6 at Westminster Abbey in London.
world.title: Which 15 countries have King Charles as their monarch?

world.author: Athira Sasidharan
world.content: A 13-year-old boy who killed eight fellow students and a security guard in a Serbian school planned the shooting for a month and had a "kill list", police said. However, it's unclear if he shot any of the students whom he named on his list. The suspect, who has been arrested, allegedly used his father's guns for Wednesday's attack.
world.title: 13-yr-old who killed 8 children at Serbia school had 'kill list'

world.author: Bhawana Chaudhary
world.content: Ukrainian air force on Thursday said that Russia was responsible for up to 24 drone attacks overnight, 18 of which were shot down. "The invaders launched up to 24 Shahed-136/131 attack drones...The Air Force...in co-operation with other air defence units, shot down 18 attack drones," it said. This comes after Russia accused Ukraine of a drone attack on the Kremlin.
world.title: 18 of 24 drones fired by Russia shot down: Ukrainian air force

world.author: Ankush Verma
world.content: Two women claim they were forced to change their clothes in public "with no cover" to board an American Airlines flight at Las Vegas' Harry Reid International Airport. Passenger Chrissie Mayr shared pictures and wrote, "Omfg an @AmericanAir employee forced me and @keanuCthompson to change our pants before getting on the flight which actually turned out to be more revealing."
world.title: Women forced to change in public to board flight in US; share pictures

world.author: Nidhi Sinha
world.content: Pakistan Foreign Minister Bilawal Bhutto posted a video message before landing in India for the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO) meeting in Goa. "I'm going to Goa today...My presence will show how important SCO is for Pakistan and how seriously it takes its membership," he said. Further, he tweeted, "I look forward to constructive discussions with my counterparts from friendly countries."
world.title: I look forward to constructive talks: Bilawal on SCO meet in Goa

world.author: Bhawana Chaudhary
world.content: UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres said that they failed to stop the war from breaking out in Sudan. "We can say we failed to avoid it to happen," he said. "The UN was taken by surprise," said Guterres, adding they were hopeful that negotiations between warring parties would be successful. "Sudan...cannot afford a struggle for power between two people," he added.
world.title: We failed to stop war from breaking out in Sudan: UN chief

world.author: Athira Sasidharan
world.content: The Israeli military demolished the homes of two Palestinians accused of carrying out attacks and killing Israelis in the occupied West Bank last year. The Israel Defense Forces (IDF) said the demolitions targeted the homes of 18-year-old Mohammed Souf accused of a "car-ramming and stabbing attack", which killed three Israelis, and Younis Hilan accused of fatally stabbing a 63-year-old Israeli.
world.title: Israeli soldiers demolish 2 Palestinian homes in West Bank

world.author: Bhuvnesh Ojha
world.content: Russia has said that it will take "retaliatory measures" if Finland's territory is used by NATO for anti-Moscow activities. "We are closely following NATO's plans regarding Finland," Russia stated. This comes after reports stated that US President Joe Biden is considering using Finland's territory to train American troops and store NATO weapons. Notably, Finland shares border with Russia.
world.title: Will take measures if NATO uses Finland's soil against us: Russia

world.author: Bhawana Chaudhary
world.content: Fans of the royal family have started camping along The Mall in central London ahead of King Charles III's Coronation. The monarch will be crowned alongside his wife, Queen Consort Camilla, at the ceremony on May 6. Several videos show that a number of royal fans have arrived in Green Park, close to Buckingham Palace.
world.title: Royal fans start camping along The Mall ahead of Coronation in UK

world.author: Athira Sasidharan
world.content: Former US President Donald Trump criticised President Joe Biden for not attending the coronation of King Charles III. "When you've somebody that's going to be sleeping instead of coming to the coronation as US President, I think it's a bad thing...It shouldn't happen...[and] is disrespectful," Trump told Britain's GB News. Biden will be represented by his wife Jill Biden.
world.title: Disrespectful: Trump on Biden skipping King Charles' coronation

world.author: Athira Sasidharan
world.content: Police have released a video showing a speeding BMW car in US crashing into another vehicle and a policeman, who was conducting a traffic stop on a highway. The BMW was being driven by a 17-year-old teen at 120 mph. "The officer was...nearly killed [in the accident]," police said. The teen, who sustained minor injuries, was charged with reckless driving.
world.title: US teen loses control of BMW, hits policeman; video surfaces

world.author: Bhawana Chaudhary
world.content: UK's Labour Party leader Sir Keir Starmer said that it takes £9,000 annually to heat Prime Minister Rishi Sunak's swimming pool. The Opposition leader said that aspiring homeowners now have to save £9,000 more, taking around four years. Calling Sunak "out-of-touch", Starmer said, "Four years for the average saver to save £9,000...roughly the annual bill to heat his swimming pool."
world.title: It costs £9,000 to heat Sunak's swimming pool: Labour's Starmer

world.author: Bhawana Chaudhary
world.content: Sri Lankan government has decided to introduce "baby boxes" for parents to leave unwanted newborns. Parents who are unwilling to raise the children can anonymously leave the infants for the state to take care of them. Department of Probation and Child Care Services said over 60 cases of parents abandoning children on streets have been reported in recent years.
world.title: Sri Lanka to introduce 'baby boxes' to leave unwanted newborns

world.author: Athira Sasidharan
world.content: Police in Brazil searched ex-President Jair Bolsonaro's home in Brasilia on Wednesday and seized his cell phone as part of an investigation into falsified COVID-19 vaccination records. "For my part, there was nothing falsified. I didn't take the vaccine," Bolsonaro said after the raid. Authorities have alleged falsified COVID-19 documents allowed Bolsonaro evade restrictions in the US and Brazil.
world.title: Brazil police raid ex-Prez Bolsonaro's home, seize his phone

world.author: Disha Jana
world.content: A video has surfaced online showing a police officer helping deliver a baby girl on a highway in US' Florida. The officer, Daniel Jones, was approached by a driver on April 30, who said his pregnant wife was about to give birth. Jones assisted the woman in delivering her baby on the side of the road inside the couple's car.
world.title: Police officer helps deliver baby on highway in US, clip surfaces

world.author: Athira Sasidharan
world.content: A male passenger allegedly punched a United Airlines flight attendant and tried to jump out of the emergency exit during a flight from San Francisco to Houston. The violence reportedly broke out after the man was told to leave someone else's seat. The airline called the passenger's behaviour "unacceptable" and said he has been banned from future United Airlines flights.
world.title: Man punches flight attendant, tries to jump out of US plane

world.author: Bhuvnesh Ojha
world.content: Ukraine is unable to use German-made Panzerhaubitze 2000 howitzers in its counter-offensive against Russia due to wet and muddy conditions on the battlefield, according to a report by The New York Times. "The problem with PzH 2000 is that they have rubber treads that are better suited to flat [and] hard surfaces, not drenched ground," Ukrainian military stated.
world.title: Ukraine unable to use German arms due to muddy conditions: Report

world.author: Bhawana Chaudhary
world.content: Former US President Donald Trump called the rape allegations against him by writer E Jean Carroll "the most ridiculous, disgusting story". In a deposition video, Trump said, "It's just made up." "If it did happen, it would have been reported within minutes," he added. Carroll has filed a lawsuit against Trump over alleged sexual assault in the mid-1990s.
world.title: Most ridiculous story: Trump on writer's rape claims against him

world.author: Bhuvnesh Ojha
world.content: Ukraine is "reluctant" to share details of its planned counter-offensive against Russia with the West due to fears that it could be leaked, according to Politico. "Kyiv officials are doing their best to keep specific details about the upcoming battlefield push a secret," the report stated. This comes after secret US documents, containing information about Ukraine war, were leaked.
world.title: Ukraine hiding Russia counterattack plan after files leak: Report

world.author: Disha Jana
world.content: Explosions were reported in Ukraine's capital Kyiv and other cities on Thursday morning following an alleged failed drone strike on the Kremlin, which Russia said was a bid to assassinate its President, Vladimir Putin. Notably, the latest blasts were reported less than 24 hours after Kyiv said 21 people died in a Russian strike on the city of Kherson.
world.title: Blasts in Kyiv & other Ukrainian cities after Kremlin drone strike

politics.author: Swati Dubey
politics.content: The Congress party has won majority of seats in the Shimla Municipal Corporation election after 10 years. It has claimed 24 out of 34 total seats in the election. The BJP secured nine seats, while the Communist Party of India (CPM) won the seat only in one ward. The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) failed to win any of the seats.
politics.title: Congress wins Shimla MC polls after 10 yrs with 24 seats, BJP at 9

politics.author: Subhangi Singh
politics.content: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Thursday criticised the "manhandling" of protesting women wrestlers in Delhi's Jantar Mantar and called the alleged act by Delhi Police "shameful". Taking to Twitter, Rahul shared a video of women wrestlers crying and wrote, "Beti Bachao is just hypocrisy! In fact, BJP has never shied away from torturing the daughters of India."
politics.title: Beti Bachao is BJP's hypocrisy: Rahul on video of wrestlers crying

politics.author: Nakul Ahuja
politics.content: A sanitation worker told NCP leader Supriya Sule to ask Sharad Pawar to reconsider his decision of resigning as the chief of NCP during her morning walk. In the video that Sule shared on Facebook, the man can be heard making the request in Marathi. Sule clicked a selfie with the man and thanked him for keeping the city clean.
politics.title: Man asks Supriya to tell Pawar not to resign during morning walk

politics.author: Nakul Ahuja
politics.content: A committee formed by former NCP chief Sharad Pawar will decide the next party chief on May 5, Friday, a senior NCP leader said on Thursday. The meeting will take place at 11 am at the party office in Mumbai, the leader said. Sharad Pawar resigned on Tuesday, however, party workers have requested him to reconsider his decision.
politics.title: NCP to decide next chief on May 5 following Pawar's resignation

politics.author: Daisy Mowke
politics.content: Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge's son Priyank has been issued a show cause notice by Election Commission for his comment on PM Narendra Modi wherein he called PM Modi 'nalayak'. "If an inept son is sitting in Delhi, how can you run...family?" he had said while addressing a rally in Karnataka. EC said it received a complaint against Priyank's speech.
politics.title: Congress chief Kharge's son gets EC notice for 'nalayak' remark on PM Modi

politics.author: Saurabh Sinha
politics.content: BJP leader Basanagouda Patil Yatnal who called Congress leader Sonia Gandhi 'vishkanya' received a show-cause notice from the Election Commission. His speech at an event in Yelburga in Koppal district on April 28 prima facie violated the Model Code of Conduct, said EC. He has been asked to submit his response by 5 pm on Thursday.
politics.title: BJP leader who called Sonia Gandhi 'vishkanya' gets EC notice

politics.author: Saurabh Sinha
politics.content: Addressing a rally in poll-bound Karnataka on Wednesday, PM Narendra Modi urged voters to say 'Jai Bajrang Bali' while casting their vote. "When you press the button in the polling booth, punish them (Congress) by saying 'Jai Bajrang Bali'," said PM Modi. This comes after Congress promised to ban Bajrang Dal if it comes to power in the state.
politics.title: Say 'Jai Bajrang Bali' while casting vote: PM Modi in Karnataka

politics.author: Nidhi Sinha
politics.content: After Congress' manifesto promised strict action against Bajrang Dal, senior party leader Veerappa Moily said there was no suggestion before Congress to ban Bajrang Dal if elected to power in Karnataka. "Supreme Court's stand over hate politics is...clear. We had made the statement in our manifesto as a part of it...We've no intention of banning Bajrang Dal," the ex-CM added.
politics.title: Don't intend to ban Bajrang Dal: Congress leader Moily on K'taka manifesto

politics.author: Subhangi Singh
politics.content: After scuffle broke out between Delhi Police and protesting wrestlers at Jantar Mantar on Wednesday night, Delhi Commission for Women (DCW) chief Swati Maliwal reached the protest site and said that she won't go without meeting wrestlers. "I have come to meet the girls since it is my statutory duty, I am not a terrorist to be stopped," she added.
politics.title: Won't leave protest site without meeting wrestlers: DCW chief

politics.author: Subhangi Singh
politics.content: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Thursday criticised BJP after wrestlers alleged that Delhi Police abused and misbehaved with them, saying the "arrogant" BJP wants to run the entire system with "hooliganism". Sharing video of Vinesh Phogat and other wrestlers addressing media and crying, Kejriwal asked people of the country to "not only uproot the BJP but also drive them out."
politics.title: Time to drive BJP out: Kejriwal on video of wrestlers crying

politics.author: Subhangi Singh
politics.content: Reacting to scuffle between Delhi Police and protesting wrestlers at Delhi's Jantar Mantar, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee said that disrobing the honour of our daughters in this manner is "utterly shameful". "The fight is right and the fight will continue. Don't dare to hurt our wrestlers, the nation is watching their tears and nation won't forgive you," she added.
politics.title: Don't dare to hurt our wrestlers: Mamata on scuffle incident

politics.author: Saurabh Sinha
politics.content: After Delhi Police claimed that AAP leader Somnath Bharti brought folding cots at wrestlers' protest site, wrestler Vinesh Phogat said that it was they who procured the "beds". "Even if Bharti brought it, or let's say the Prime Minister sent it, don't we have the right to sleep?" Phogat asked. "Was it a bomb or a weapon?" she asked.
politics.title: Don't we have right to sleep: Vinesh after cots reach protest site

politics.author: Nakul Ahuja
politics.content: Priyanka Gandhi on Wednesday said BJP looted ₹1.5 lakh crore from Karnataka in the last three and a half years. “With the amount of money they looted, you could have built 100 AIIMS hospitals, 30,000 smart classrooms and houses for 30 lakh poor people,” Priyanka said. She alleged BJP is raising issues which have nothing to do with Karnataka’s development.
politics.title: BJP looted ₹1.5 lakh cr, could've built 100 AIIMS: Priyanka Gandhi

politics.author: Apoorva Shankar
politics.content: After Congress promised in its election manifesto to ban Bajrang Dal, party MLA Rizwan Arshad on Wednesday said Bajrang Dal is involved in violence, believes in violence and takes law into its hands. "It is on record," Arshad said. "Congress government will deal with it very strongly and seriously. What is wrong with that? Why should they oppose," he asked.
politics.title: Bajrang Dal involved in violence, believes in violence: Congress

politics.author: Swati Dubey
politics.content: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel tweeted a video of a boy using abusive words against him and claimed that he's a Bajrang Dal member. "This child who is refraining from taking the name of Lord Ram is abusing me," he wrote. "See what these people have done to our children under the guise of religion," CM Baghel added.
politics.title: CM Baghel posts clip of boy abusing him, says he's from Bajrang Dal

politics.author: Bhuvnesh Ojha
politics.content: Reacting to Congress' manifesto for Karnataka polls where it proposed to ban Bajrang Dal, former CM HD Kumaraswamy asked why Congress did not ban the outfit when it was in power for five years. "Why are they raising...issue now? We have to change the culture of those organisations," the JDS leader stated. Karnataka will go to polls on May 10.
politics.title: Why Congress didn't ban Bajrang Dal when it was in power? JDS

politics.author: Subhangi Singh
