politics.content: Reacting to the incidents of violence in Manipur, Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge blamed BJP for it and said that BJP has created fissures among communities and destroyed the peace of a beautiful state. "Manipur is burning...BJP's politics of hate, division and its greed for power is responsible for this mess," Kharge said in a tweet on Thursday.
politics.title: Manipur is burning, BJP's politics of hate responsible: Congress

politics.author: Nakul Ahuja
politics.content: In the second part of his autobiography, former NCP chief Sharad Pawar mentioned his driver 'Gama', who has been taking him to various parts of Maharashtra for the last 43 years. "Gama is at times my guardian as well. He takes all the necessary care, including about my clothes, travel items, medicines and diet," Pawar said in his book.
politics.title: Driver of 43 yrs my guardian, takes care of meds & clothes: Pawar

politics.author: Saurabh Sinha
politics.content: BJP Bihar chief Samrat Choudhary on Wednesday alleged that CM Nitish Kumar's party JD(U) is doing "a scam to the tune of ₹10,000 crores in illicit liquor". "Today alcohol has reached every home and Nitish Kumar is getting money through home delivery," Choudhary said. "The administration is collaborating with the liquor mafia," he added.
politics.title: Nitish getting money through home delivery of alcohol: BJP leader

politics.author: Swati Dubey
politics.content: Chhattisgarh BJP leader Brijmohan Agrawal accused Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Priyanka Gandhi of misleading people and said, "[They] misled the people by changing their faces like 'Ravana' & 'Tadaka'." He further criticised CM Bhupesh Baghel and said, "[He] speaks about building 'Kaushalaya temple' while on the other hand, he speaks of banning the name of 'Bajrangbali'."
politics.title: Rahul & Priyanka change faces like 'Ravana' & 'Tadaka': BJP leader

politics.author: Nidhi Sinha
politics.content: Haryana's youngest MLA Bhavya Bishnoi got engaged to IAS officer Pari Bishnoi in Rajasthan on Tuesday. Bhavya, who is 30 years old, is the grandson of Haryana's former CM Bhajan Lal and the son of BJP leader Kuldeep Bishnoi. Meanwhile, Pari Bishnoi is currently posted in Sikkim cadre. The 2020 batch officer scored 30th rank in the 2019 UPSC examination.
politics.title: Haryana's youngest MLA Bhavya gets engaged to IAS officer Pari

politics.author: Bhuvnesh Ojha
politics.content: Union Minister Meenakashi Lekhi has said AAP spent ₹45 crore on the renovation of Delhi CM's residence when Delhi was suffering from "food, sanitiser and mask shortages". She stated when people weren't allowed to leave home due to COVID-19, construction work was being carried out at CM's house. Lekhi added there was a "scam" in the renovation of the house.
politics.title: When Delhi had food shortage, AAP spent ₹45 cr on CM's house: BJP

politics.author: Nakul Ahuja
politics.content: BJP MLA Madan Dilawar recently said, "Mallikarjun Kharge is 80 years old. God can take him away anytime. But I will pray that he lives for 200 years." Congress' Randeep Surjewala criticised Dilawar for his remark, saying his hatred for Kharge is "disgusting, filthy, nauseating, unacceptable and reprehensible". Notably, Kharge had earlier called PM Narendra Modi a "poisonous snake".
politics.title: Kharge is 80 yrs old, God can take him away anytime: BJP's Madan

politics.author: Subhangi Singh
politics.content: Voting for the first phase of municipal polls to elect urban body chiefs in 37 districts of Uttar Pradesh began on Thursday morning. More than 2 crore people are eligible to vote in the first phase, in which the fate of 44,232 candidates will be decided. UP CM Yogi Adityanath also cast his vote from Gorakhpur and shared a picture.
politics.title: Voting begins in UP municipal elections, CM Yogi casts his vote

politics.author: Nidhi Sinha
politics.content: Congress MP Randeep Surjewala said BJP MLA Madan Dilawar's hatred for Congress chief Mallikarjun Kharge, who's the "tallest Scheduled Caste leader" in Karnataka's recent history, is "disgusting" and "nauseating". Dilawar had recently said, "Kharge is 80 years old. God can take him away anytime." "Just because...BJP [has] lost the plot [in Karnataka]...you wish death to...Kharge?" Surjewala asked.
politics.title: Disgusting: Randeep Surjewala on 'God can take Kharge away' remark

entertainment.author: Kameshwari
entertainment.content: Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) MLA Nitesh Rane demanded 'The Kerala Story' to be declared tax-free in Maharashtra. "The subject of the...film is based on Love Jihad...It's very important for the people...to know...what...Love Jihad is," a memorandum Rane gave to Minister of Cultural Affairs Sudhir Mungantiwar read. The film is directed by Sudipto Sen and produced by Vipul Amrutlal Shah.
entertainment.title: BJP MLA demands 'The Kerala Story' to be tax-free in Maharashtra

entertainment.author: Daisy Mowke
entertainment.content: Actress Parineeti Chopra and AAP leader Raghav Chadha were spotted watching an IPL match between Punjab Kings and Mumbai Indians in Mohali on Wednesday. As per reports, they are set to get engaged on May 13. The ceremony will take place in New Delhi, reports further said. Rumours of the two dating surfaced after they were spotted together in Mumbai.
entertainment.title: Parineeti Chopra and Raghav Chadha spotted watching IPL match In Mohali, pic surfaces

entertainment.author: Daisy Mowke
entertainment.content: Actress Ileana D'Cruz, who recently announced her pregnancy, has shared a video on her Instagram Stories wherein she can be seen showing her baby bump for the first time. Sharing the video of her baby bump, Ileana wrote, "Life lately." The actress announced her pregnancy via a post on Instagram last month.
entertainment.title: Ileana D'Cruz shows baby bump for first time after announcing pregnancy

entertainment.author: Pragya Swastik
entertainment.content: Actress Emma Watson, 33, has enrolled in Oxford University's MA in Creative Writing course starting in September 2023. Previously, she attended Oxford during the 2011 to 2012 academic year as part of the Visiting Student Programme. She took part in the programme while she deferred her degree at Brown University for the filming of the 'Harry Potter' franchise.
entertainment.title: 33-year-old Emma Watson to return to Oxford University for Master's degree

entertainment.author: Daisy Mowke
entertainment.content: Amid backlash, the trailer for 'The Kerala Story' has been altered. While it originally suggested that the film is based on stories of more than 32,000 women, the revised version of the description on YouTube says it's based on "true stories of three young girls". "The plot thickens...Filmmakers have updated...movie's description...I rest my case," Congress MP Shashi Tharoor tweeted.
entertainment.title: 'The Kerala Story' trailer description changed from 32,000 to 3 women, Tharoor reacts

entertainment.author: Ankush Verma
entertainment.content: Turkish pop singer Gulsen was handed a 10-month suspended sentence for "inciting hatred and enmity" over a joke about the country's religious schools. Gulsen was briefly jailed last year for the joke which she had made during a concert. She had said that the "perversion" of one of her musicians came from attending a religious school.
entertainment.title: Turkish singer Gulsen sentenced over her mid-concert joke on religious schools

entertainment.author: Ankush Verma
entertainment.content: Commenting on her botched nose surgery, Priyanka Chopra said, "It was a dark phase...My face looked completely different, and I went into a deep, deep depression." Priyanka added that she was fired from three films. The actress went through the doctor-recommended surgery to get a polyp in her nasal cavity removed during initial stages of her career.
entertainment.title: Fell into deep depression, was fired from three films: Priyanka on botched nose surgery

entertainment.author: Ankush Verma
entertainment.content: Sunny Deol's son Karan got engaged in a private ceremony a few months ago and the wedding will happen next month, according to a report. His fiancée reportedly does not belong to the film industry. Karan made his Bollywood debut in 2019 with 'Pal Pal Dil Ke Paas', which was directed by Sunny Deol.
entertainment.title: Sunny Deol's son Karan engaged, wedding to take place in June: Report

entertainment.author: Ankush Verma
entertainment.content: AR Rahman took to Twitter to share a video of a Hindu wedding that took place inside a mosque in Kerala amid the issue over the movie 'The Kerala Story'. "Bravo, love for humanity has to be unconditional and healing," he wrote. Reacting to the video, a Twitter user wrote, "This is the way humanity should go."
entertainment.title: AR Rahman shares video of Hindu wedding inside mosque amid 'The Kerala Story' issue

entertainment.author: Kameshwari
entertainment.content: Sheezan Khan's lawyer Shailendra Mishra shared that the court has permitted the actor to travel abroad for Rohit Shetty's hosted show 'Khatron Ke Khiladi 13', which will be shot in South Africa. Sheezan was arrested on December 25 after his former girlfriend and co-star Tunisha Sharma died. He was arrested on abetment of suicide charge based on Tunisha's mother's complaint.
entertainment.title: Court permitted Sheezan to travel abroad for 'Khatron...': Lawyer

entertainment.author: Kameshwari
entertainment.content: Sriram Raghavan said that while he enjoys watching some of the sequences of 'Agent Vinod', it turned out to be a "headache" instead of being "heady cocktail". "One mistake I made is to take it for granted that the story isn't vital, the sequences are vital...I loved the title so I thought it'll be a nice camp movie," Raghavan added.
entertainment.title: It turned out to be a headache: Sriram Raghavan on 'Agent Vinod'

entertainment.author: Bhawana Chaudhary
entertainment.content: Late actor Shammi Kapoor's wife Neila Kapoor said that it was her decision to bring up his first wife Geeta Bali's children as her own. "Shammi had once said that he'd be very happy...[to] see Kanchan and Aditya in my lap," Neila said. "That day I decided that I'll see to it that they become my real children," she added.
entertainment.title: I decided to bring up Shammi's 1st wife's children as mine: Neila

entertainment.author: Bhawana Chaudhary
entertainment.content: Actor Ranbir Kapoor, in an interaction with fans, revealed that he used to stammer a lot as a child. While answering a question of a fan, who was stammering, Ranbir said, "When someone would ask me my name, I would stammer at that also." "It happens sometimes even now but you should...be very balanced...try and meditate," Ranbir further said.
entertainment.title: I stammered a lot as a child, happens even now at times: Ranbir

entertainment.author: Kameshwari
entertainment.content: Singer Hariharan shared that when he watched 'Roja', he was "very disappointed" because the song came during the closing credits of the film. "People [were] leaving...theatre. I kept telling the people around me to stop and listen...I kept wondering 'where's my song? Has it been cut'," he said. He acknowledged that the song became popular and achieved "tremendous" fame.
entertainment.title: Was upset that 'Bharat...' song came at the end of Roja: Hariharan

entertainment.author: Kameshwari
entertainment.content: Actress Suhasini Hasan, wife of filmmaker Mani Ratnam, said she spoke to late actor-filmmaker Manobala 15 days before his death. "It's a big loss...He's closer to me than a brother," she said as she mourned the loss. "You'll never find...director who can plan as well as Manobala...He had a great sense of music, dance, art, and costume," she added.
entertainment.title: He spoke to me 15 days back: Suhasini on actor-director Manobala

entertainment.author: Kameshwari
entertainment.content: Anil Kapoor on Wednesday celebrated 38 years of 'Yudh' and spoke about how working with Nutan reminded him of his mother because she was "so warm and caring". He added that the film also marks 38 years since his popular dialogue 'Jhakassss' came into everyone's lives. "'Yudh' really was a gift that hasn't stopped giving," he concluded.
entertainment.title: 38 yrs since 'Jhakassss' came into our lives: Anil Kapoor on Yudh

entertainment.author: Apoorva Shankar
entertainment.content: PK Firos, General Secretary of Kerala Muslim Youth League, on Wednesday said the film 'The Kerala Story' should not be screened as it is "insulting to Muslims, Kerala and girls". "This movie is about...hatred of others towards a particular religion or community," Firos said. "People of Kerala, India and around the world are convinced this is fake propaganda," he added.
entertainment.title: Shouldn't be screened: State Muslim Youth League on 'Kerala Story'

entertainment.author: Kameshwari
entertainment.content: Gulshan Devaiah was seen teasing Vijay Varma at the trailer launch event of their upcoming project 'Dahaad'. The video shows Devaiah indirectly mentioning Tamannaah Bhatia's name, which left Vijay Varma speechless as well as smiling. The rumours of Tamannaah and Vijay dating each other first hit the internet when they were spotted together at a New Year's party in Goa.
entertainment.title: Gulshan Devaiah teases Vijay Varma about Tamannaah, video surfaces

entertainment.author: Kameshwari
entertainment.content: Backstreet Boys, who have arrived in India for their DNA World Tour Concert, were welcomed by Mumbai's hotel staff with a dance performance on their hit numbers. Nick Carter of Backstreet Boys shared a video on Instagram. "The hotel staff had...Bollywood style dance prepared remixing all our songs...we really do have fans all over the world," Carter wrote.
entertainment.title: Video shows Mumbai hotel staff's dance to welcome Backstreet Boys

entertainment.author: Bhawana Chaudhary
entertainment.content: Actress Isha Talwar, who played the role of Madhuri in the second season of 'Mirzapur', said that it took her 10 years to get a show like 'Mirzapur'. Isha added that she stopped giving auditions after doing the show. "I sat at home for a year after 'Mirzapur', until I could get 'Saas, Bahu aur Flamingo'," she said.
entertainment.title: It took me 10 years to get a show like Mirzapur: Isha Talwar

entertainment.author: Kameshwari
entertainment.content: Shark Tank India's Anupam Mittal recalled watching Ram Gopal Varma's 'Aag' with Amitabh Bachchan and the filmmaker. "I could see Mr Bachchan had absolutely zero expression on his face. I think he knew it [was bad]. But it's okay, it's creative work. Nobody starts out wanting to make...flop," Mittal said in an interview. The 2007 film also starred Mohanlal.
entertainment.title: He had zero expression: Anupam Mittal on watching 'Aag' with Big B

entertainment.author: Kameshwari
entertainment.content: Javed Akhtar, before a magistrate court on Wednesday, shared that he had to file the defamation case against Kangana Ranaut as her claims against him were "getting bigger...embarrassing". "I was feeling humiliated. People didn't let me forget," he said while talking about Kangana's interview, taken in 2020, in which she claimed that Akhtar "was forcing her to commit suicide".
entertainment.title: I was feeling humiliated: Javed on defamation case against Kangana

entertainment.author: Kameshwari
entertainment.content: Singer-actor Diljit Dosanjh spoke about his viral video from Coachella music festival in which he was heard saying, "Punjabi aa gaye Coachella oye". "It was just what I was feeling after...first song...We were all excited," Dosanjh shared. He said he was told that this was the first time when someone was going to speak in Punjabi on the Coachella's stage.
entertainment.title: It was what I felt: Diljit on 'Punjabi aa gaye Coachella' line

entertainment.author: Nakul Ahuja
entertainment.content: Actor Vidyut Jammwal spoke about his upcoming movie 'Crakk' during one of his recent interviews.  "It's the first extreme sports film out of India, ever. It is authentic and it's about the extreme sports athletes. So we have finished 60% of it," he said, adding that the concept of the film is something new for the audience.
entertainment.title: 'Crakk' 1st extreme sports film out of India, 60% done: Vidyut

entertainment.author: Bhawana Chaudhary
entertainment.content: Actor Sooraj Pancholi on Wednesday visited Gurdwara Bangla Sahib in Delhi to seek blessings after being acquitted in the 2013 suicide case of actress Jiah Khan. The actor took to Instagram to share the pictures and captioned the post with folded hands emoji. Last week, a CBI court acquitted Sooraj of abetment to suicide charges in the case.
entertainment.title: Sooraj visits Gurdwara Bangla Sahib after Jiah Khan case verdict

others.author: Roshan Gupta
others.content: Cherry by Kotak, an investment app from Kotak, launched its #CherryAndChill campaign. Cherry lets you invest in Mutual Funds, Stocks, and Bonds on a single platform. India's top fund houses have created Mutual Fund Baskets for different investor profiles on Cherry. The ad campaign's premise is, "Now, you don't have to worry about investments. You can just #CherryAndChill."
others.title: Now, no investment worries, just #CherryAndChill: Cherry by Kotak

others.author: Roshan Gupta
others.content: Customers can avail exciting offers on smartphones during Flipkart Big Saving Days sale, including a deal on iPhone 13, which is expected under ₹55,000*. They can also buy the flagship Samsung S21 FE 5G for just ₹29,999*. The sale starts from 3rd May, 12 PM onwards for Plus members and on 4th May, 12 PM onwards for others.
others.title: Exclusive offers from Samsung, Apple & more on Big Saving Days: Flipkart

others.author: Nakul Ahuja
others.content: A TikToker broke down after strangers in the UK refused her offer to pay for their groceries. In a video that surfaced online, Amelia Goldsmith asked a man if she could pay for his groceries, but she was turned down. She asked another woman, but she too refused, saying, "There are a lot more deserving people in the world."
others.title: TikToker cries as people refuse offer to pay for groceries in UK

others.author: Sakshita Khosla
others.content: Amid a ban on Viagra in Pakistan, some men are buying 'Sanda Tel', which is freshly-extracted lizard fat marinated in scorpion oil and seasoned with pungent red spice, a report has said. The "quack aphrodisiac" oil, which reportedly has no scientific backing, is being sold with claims of promoting sexual stamina. It's extracted from Hardwicke's spiny-tailed lizard.
others.title: Pakistani men buying 'aphrodisiac' lizard oil amid ban on Viagra: Report

others.author: Sakshita Khosla
others.content: A video of a goat thief throwing the animals from a moving truck onto a highway in Maharashtra has been widely shared online. It shows several goats being thrown from the truck after which the thief is seen escaping by climbing the roof of a car that was moving alongside the truck. The video is said to be from Igatpuri.
others.title: Video shows thief throwing goats from moving truck, escaping on car's roof in Maha

others.author: Pragya Swastik
others.content: A corpse was found under the bed at 'Guzang Shuhua Inn', a Tibetan hotel popular as an 'influencer hotel' on social media for being an ideal spot for photos. The dead body was discovered after a Chinese guest vacated the room due to a strong smell. Police have arrested a suspect as part of their investigation.
others.title: Dead body found under bed at Tibet's popular 'influencer hotel'

others.author: Pragya Swastik
others.content: Archaeologists have discovered the remains of a 19th-century quarantine hospital and cemetery submerged in the waters off the Dry Tortugas National Park in the Florida Keys. The hospital on a now-submerged island was used to treat yellow fever patients at the fort between 1890 and 1900. A headstone from 1861, part of the Fort Jefferson Post Cemetery, was also found.
others.title: 19th-century hospital, cemetery found underwater in US

others.author: Nakul Ahuja
others.content: 'Chaka' has become the first penguin in the world to undergo an MRI scan. He underwent an MRI after specialists observed the penguin was experiencing occasional wobbling during waddling. Speaking about the procedure, Pippa Tucker at Cave Veterinary Specialists, said, "His scan now brings a range of new knowledge to help support future care of other penguins."
others.title: UK penguin who 'wobbles' becomes 1st in the world to get MRI scan

others.author: Anmol Sharma
others.content: Police in Netherlands' Groningen arrested a man for drunk driving and found he had fake Ukrainian driving licence naming him Boris Johnson. The licence, complete with the ex-UK PM's picture and correct birth date, was "issued" in 2019 and valid until the end of the year 3000. "The person couldn't identify himself and refused to undertake...breathalyser test," an official said.
others.title: Man flashes fake Boris Johnson licence on being arrested for drunk driving in Netherlands

others.author: Pragya Swastik
others.content: The Richat Structure, also known as the 'Eye of the Sahara', was pictured from the International Space Station (ISS) as it orbited over 250 miles above North Africa. It is an eroded geological dome in Mauritania. The circular geologic feature is thought to be caused by an uplifted dome that has been eroded to expose the originally flat rock layers.
others.title: 'Eye of the Sahara' spotted from space, pics released

others.author: Daisy Mowke
others.content: A Sun halo was spotted in the skies of Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj on Friday, pictures of which were shared online. It occurs when sunlight interacts with ice crystals, found in cirrus clouds, which are thin and wispy. When sunlight enters these ice crystals, it's refracted. This bending of light causes Sun's rays to separate into many colours, creating a spectrum.
others.title: Sun halo spotted in UP's Prayagraj, pics surface

others.author: Daisy Mowke
others.content: The most diamonds set in one ring stands at 50,907, and was achieved by HK Designs and Hari Krishna Exports Pvt Ltd in Mumbai on March 11, 2023, said Guinness World Records. It's completely made out of recycled gold and diamonds re-purposed from returns received from customers. According to HK Designs, the ring has a value of $7,85,645 (₹6.4 crore).
others.title: Indian jeweller's ring with 50,907 diamonds sets world record; pics released

others.author: Hiral Goyal
others.content: A student ate a banana that was duct-taped to the wall of a Seoul museum as part of an art installation by Italian artist Maurizio Cattelan. The student taped the peel back on to the wall and told the museum he ate the fruit because he was hungry. The artwork sold for $120,000 at Art Basel Miami Beach in 2019.
others.title: Student eats artwork of banana taped to museum wall in Seoul, says 'I was hungry'

others.author: Nakul Ahuja
others.content: A man from UK, identified as James Goss, has broken his own Guinness World Record for the most facial flesh tunnels, after increasing the number of tunnels to 17 from 15. "For me, expressing myself regardless of what other people think has made me feel a lot more fulfilled," he said, adding that he's listed the record in his CV.
others.title: UK man with 17 facial flesh tunnels breaks his own Guinness Record

others.author: Pragya Swastik
others.content: Kelsey Grubb, a 32-year-old woman from the US, has the largest foot rotation (female) and can turn her foot 171.4 degrees, Guinness World Records said. Kelsey said rotating her foot doesn't hurt, although she can sometimes feel it slightly in her knee and might need to rotate her foot a bit slower. "I never really trained or anything," she added.
others.title: US woman breaks world record by rotating her foot 171.4 degrees

others.author: Daisy Mowke
others.content: A Class 7 student in Michigan, US saved the lives of 66 passengers by controlling the school bus after the driver fell unconscious. In a video released by Warren Consolidated Schools, he can be heard saying "Someone call 911, now" to others. Superintendent Robert Livernois said the bus was beginning to veer into what would have been incoming traffic.
others.title: Class 7 student controls bus as driver falls unconscious in US, saves 66 people

others.author: Pragya Swastik
others.content: A 26-year-old man was arrested at the Boston Logan International Airport, US, for carrying "vampire straw". The police said that the 10-inch-long titanium straw with a bevelled end was a "dangerous weapon". The company behind the straw, which can also be used to slurp down drinks, calls it a self-defence weapon since it can be used like a dagger.
others.title: Man arrested for carrying 'vampire straw' at US airport

others.author: Sakshita Khosla
others.content: IFS officer Susanta Nanda tweeted a video of a tiger waiting beside some bushes as a herd of elephants passes by, saying, "This is how animals communicate and maintain harmony." He added, "Elephant trumpets on smelling the tiger. The king gives way to the titan herd." "(It) looks like a scene out of Jungle Book," said a Twitter user.
others.title: King gives way to Titans: IFS officer on video of tiger making way for elephants

others.author: Arshiya Chopra
others.content: A video of a cockroach on Met Gala 2023 red carpet is going viral on social media. The video shows the cockroach crawling on the red carpet while a photographer tries to click its pictures. Several social media users commented on the video, with one saying, "Best dressed". "Stunning. This one understood the assignment," a person commented.
others.title: Video of cockroach on Met Gala red carpet goes viral

others.author: Ankush Verma
others.content: A picture of Met Gala's dinner menu has gone viral on social media. The guests were served chilled spring pea soup with baby vegetables, lemon creme fraiche and truffle snow. The menu also included Ora King salmon, vegetable nage, asparagus, and pickled strawberries. Reacting to the menu, social media users wrote, "Appetite suppressant," and "The food menu sounds disgusting."
others.title: Pic of Met Gala's dinner menu goes viral; social media users react

others.author: Daisy Mowke
others.content: Four sisters from UK are pregnant at the same time in a rare situation. Kayleigh Stewart, 29, and her sister Jay Goodwillie, 35, will give birth to baby boys this month. Kerry-Anne Thomson, 41, and Amy Goodwillie, 24, are in early stages of their pregnancies. The number of children in their family will double from four to eight before Christmas.
others.title: 4 sisters pregnant at the same time in UK, pic surfaces

others.author: Arshiya Chopra
others.content: A 16-year-old boy has been left with third degree burns while attempting 'torch' TikTok challenge in the US' North Carolina. He was using a lighter and can of spray paint to create a makeshift blowtorch, when the spray paint he was holding exploded in his hand and engulfed him in fire. "He's unrecognisable," his mother said.
others.title: Boy left with 3rd degree burns after explosion during 'torch' TikTok challenge in US

others.author: Swati Dubey
others.content: A policeman in Kerala's Kanjirapally was dismissed from his job for stealing mangoes from a shop. The Idukki district police chief gave the order, stating that his actions have brought embarrassment to the police force. The decision came after CCTV footage showed the policeman taking boxes of mangoes worth over ₹500 per kg and loading them onto his two-wheeler.
others.title: Policeman dismissed for stealing mangoes from a shop in Kerala

others.author: Swati Dubey
others.content: A video showing a tiger charging at tourists on a jungle safari at Uttarakhand's Jim Corbett National Park was tweeted by a forest officer. The footage shows the tiger emerging from the bushes, roaring and charging towards the vehicle. The jeep guide scares off the tiger, but the tourists can be heard screaming out of fear in the video.
others.title: Video shows tiger nearly attacks tourists on safari at Jim Corbett

others.author: Nidhi Sinha
others.content: A video has surfaced showing a 94-year-old man using a hand fan made of peacock feathers to fan devotees at Chithirai festival in Tamil Nadu's Madurai. The man, Natarajan, said that he has been doing this for the past 69 years to offer devotees some respite from the heat. Natarajan was also seen dancing while holding the huge hand fan.
others.title: 94-yr-old man fans people with peacock feathers at festival in TN

entertainment.author: Kameshwari
entertainment.content: Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) MLA Nitesh Rane demanded 'The Kerala Story' to be declared tax-free in Maharashtra. "The subject of the...film is based on Love Jihad...It's very important for the people...to know...what...Love Jihad is," a memorandum Rane gave to Minister of Cultural Affairs Sudhir Mungantiwar read. The film is directed by Sudipto Sen and produced by Vipul Amrutlal Shah.
entertainment.title: BJP MLA demands 'The Kerala Story' to be tax-free in Maharashtra

entertainment.author: Ankush Verma
entertainment.content: Commenting on her botched nose surgery, Priyanka Chopra said, "It was a dark phase...My face looked completely different, and I went into a deep, deep depression." Priyanka added that she was fired from three films. The actress went through the doctor-recommended surgery to get a polyp in her nasal cavity removed during initial stages of her career.
entertainment.title: Fell into deep depression, was fired from three films: Priyanka on botched nose surgery

entertainment.author: Daisy Mowke
entertainment.content: Actress Parineeti Chopra and AAP leader Raghav Chadha were spotted watching an IPL match between Punjab Kings and Mumbai Indians in Mohali on Wednesday. As per reports, they are set to get engaged on May 13. The ceremony will take place in New Delhi, reports further said. Rumours of the two dating surfaced after they were spotted together in Mumbai.
entertainment.title: Parineeti Chopra and Raghav Chadha spotted watching IPL match In Mohali, pic surfaces

entertainment.author: Pragya Swastik
entertainment.content: Actress Emma Watson, 33, has enrolled in Oxford University's MA in Creative Writing course starting in September 2023. Previously, she attended Oxford during the 2011 to 2012 academic year as part of the Visiting Student Programme. She took part in the programme while she deferred her degree at Brown University for the filming of the 'Harry Potter' franchise.
entertainment.title: 33-year-old Emma Watson to return to Oxford University for Master's degree

entertainment.author: Daisy Mowke
entertainment.content: Amid backlash, the trailer for 'The Kerala Story' has been altered. While it originally suggested that the film is based on stories of more than 32,000 women, the revised version of the description on YouTube says it's based on "true stories of three young girls". "The plot thickens...Filmmakers have updated...movie's description...I rest my case," Congress MP Shashi Tharoor tweeted.
entertainment.title: 'The Kerala Story' trailer description changed from 32,000 to 3 women, Tharoor reacts

entertainment.author: Ankush Verma
entertainment.content: Sunny Deol's son Karan got engaged in a private ceremony a few months ago and the wedding will happen next month, according to a report. His fiancée reportedly does not belong to the film industry. Karan made his Bollywood debut in 2019 with 'Pal Pal Dil Ke Paas', which was directed by Sunny Deol.
entertainment.title: Sunny Deol's son Karan engaged, wedding to take place in June: Report

entertainment.author: Ankush Verma
entertainment.content: Turkish pop singer Gulsen was handed a 10-month suspended sentence for "inciting hatred and enmity" over a joke about the country's religious schools. Gulsen was briefly jailed last year for the joke which she had made during a concert. She had said that the "perversion" of one of her musicians came from attending a religious school.
entertainment.title: Turkish singer Gulsen sentenced over her mid-concert joke on religious schools

entertainment.author: Ankush Verma
entertainment.content: AR Rahman took to Twitter to share a video of a Hindu wedding that took place inside a mosque in Kerala amid the issue over the movie 'The Kerala Story'. "Bravo, love for humanity has to be unconditional and healing," he wrote. Reacting to the video, a Twitter user wrote, "This is the way humanity should go."
entertainment.title: AR Rahman shares video of Hindu wedding inside mosque amid 'The Kerala Story' issue

entertainment.author: Daisy Mowke
entertainment.content: Actress Ileana D'Cruz, who recently announced her pregnancy, has shared a video on her Instagram Stories wherein she can be seen showing her baby bump for the first time. Sharing the video of her baby bump, Ileana wrote, "Life lately." The actress announced her pregnancy via a post on Instagram last month.
entertainment.title: Ileana D'Cruz shows baby bump for first time after announcing pregnancy

entertainment.author: Kameshwari
entertainment.content: Actress Suhasini Hasan, wife of filmmaker Mani Ratnam, said she spoke to late actor-filmmaker Manobala 15 days before his death. "It's a big loss...He's closer to me than a brother," she said as she mourned the loss. "You'll never find...director who can plan as well as Manobala...He had a great sense of music, dance, art, and costume," she added.
entertainment.title: He spoke to me 15 days back: Suhasini on actor-director Manobala

entertainment.author: Bhawana Chaudhary
entertainment.content: Late actor Shammi Kapoor's wife Neila Kapoor said that it was her decision to bring up his first wife Geeta Bali's children as her own. "Shammi had once said that he'd be very happy...[to] see Kanchan and Aditya in my lap," Neila said. "That day I decided that I'll see to it that they become my real children," she added.
entertainment.title: I decided to bring up Shammi's 1st wife's children as mine: Neila

entertainment.author: Bhawana Chaudhary
entertainment.content: Actress Isha Talwar, who played the role of Madhuri in the second season of 'Mirzapur', said that it took her 10 years to get a show like 'Mirzapur'. Isha added that she stopped giving auditions after doing the show. "I sat at home for a year after 'Mirzapur', until I could get 'Saas, Bahu aur Flamingo'," she said.
entertainment.title: It took me 10 years to get a show like Mirzapur: Isha Talwar

entertainment.author: Bhawana Chaudhary
entertainment.content: Actor Sooraj Pancholi on Wednesday visited Gurdwara Bangla Sahib in Delhi to seek blessings after being acquitted in the 2013 suicide case of actress Jiah Khan. The actor took to Instagram to share the pictures and captioned the post with folded hands emoji. Last week, a CBI court acquitted Sooraj of abetment to suicide charges in the case.
entertainment.title: Sooraj visits Gurdwara Bangla Sahib after Jiah Khan case verdict

entertainment.author: Apoorva Shankar
entertainment.content: PK Firos, General Secretary of Kerala Muslim Youth League, on Wednesday said the film 'The Kerala Story' should not be screened as it is "insulting to Muslims, Kerala and girls". "This movie is about...hatred of others towards a particular religion or community," Firos said. "People of Kerala, India and around the world are convinced this is fake propaganda," he added.
entertainment.title: Shouldn't be screened: State Muslim Youth League on 'Kerala Story'

entertainment.author: Kameshwari
entertainment.content: Sheezan Khan's lawyer Shailendra Mishra shared that the court has permitted the actor to travel abroad for Rohit Shetty's hosted show 'Khatron Ke Khiladi 13', which will be shot in South Africa. Sheezan was arrested on December 25 after his former girlfriend and co-star Tunisha Sharma died. He was arrested on abetment of suicide charge based on Tunisha's mother's complaint.
entertainment.title: Court permitted Sheezan to travel abroad for 'Khatron...': Lawyer

entertainment.author: Kameshwari
entertainment.content: Singer-actor Diljit Dosanjh spoke about his viral video from Coachella music festival in which he was heard saying, "Punjabi aa gaye Coachella oye". "It was just what I was feeling after...first song...We were all excited," Dosanjh shared. He said he was told that this was the first time when someone was going to speak in Punjabi on the Coachella's stage.
entertainment.title: It was what I felt: Diljit on 'Punjabi aa gaye Coachella' line

entertainment.author: Kameshwari
entertainment.content: Sriram Raghavan said that while he enjoys watching some of the sequences of 'Agent Vinod', it turned out to be a "headache" instead of being "heady cocktail". "One mistake I made is to take it for granted that the story isn't vital, the sequences are vital...I loved the title so I thought it'll be a nice camp movie," Raghavan added.
entertainment.title: It turned out to be a headache: Sriram Raghavan on 'Agent Vinod'

entertainment.author: Kameshwari
entertainment.content: Javed Akhtar, before a magistrate court on Wednesday, shared that he had to file the defamation case against Kangana Ranaut as her claims against him were "getting bigger...embarrassing". "I was feeling humiliated. People didn't let me forget," he said while talking about Kangana's interview, taken in 2020, in which she claimed that Akhtar "was forcing her to commit suicide".
entertainment.title: I was feeling humiliated: Javed on defamation case against Kangana

entertainment.author: Bhawana Chaudhary
entertainment.content: Actor Ranbir Kapoor, in an interaction with fans, revealed that he used to stammer a lot as a child. While answering a question of a fan, who was stammering, Ranbir said, "When someone would ask me my name, I would stammer at that also." "It happens sometimes even now but you should...be very balanced...try and meditate," Ranbir further said.
entertainment.title: I stammered a lot as a child, happens even now at times: Ranbir

entertainment.author: Kameshwari
entertainment.content: Backstreet Boys, who have arrived in India for their DNA World Tour Concert, were welcomed by Mumbai's hotel staff with a dance performance on their hit numbers. Nick Carter of Backstreet Boys shared a video on Instagram. "The hotel staff had...Bollywood style dance prepared remixing all our songs...we really do have fans all over the world," Carter wrote.
entertainment.title: Video shows Mumbai hotel staff's dance to welcome Backstreet Boys

entertainment.author: Kameshwari
entertainment.content: Anil Kapoor on Wednesday celebrated 38 years of 'Yudh' and spoke about how working with Nutan reminded him of his mother because she was "so warm and caring". He added that the film also marks 38 years since his popular dialogue 'Jhakassss' came into everyone's lives. "'Yudh' really was a gift that hasn't stopped giving," he concluded.
entertainment.title: 38 yrs since 'Jhakassss' came into our lives: Anil Kapoor on Yudh

entertainment.author: Nakul Ahuja
entertainment.content: Actor Vidyut Jammwal spoke about his upcoming movie 'Crakk' during one of his recent interviews.  "It's the first extreme sports film out of India, ever. It is authentic and it's about the extreme sports athletes. So we have finished 60% of it," he said, adding that the concept of the film is something new for the audience.
entertainment.title: 'Crakk' 1st extreme sports film out of India, 60% done: Vidyut

entertainment.author: Kameshwari
entertainment.content: Singer Hariharan shared that when he watched 'Roja', he was "very disappointed" because the song came during the closing credits of the film. "People [were] leaving...theatre. I kept telling the people around me to stop and listen...I kept wondering 'where's my song? Has it been cut'," he said. He acknowledged that the song became popular and achieved "tremendous" fame.
entertainment.title: Was upset that 'Bharat...' song came at the end of Roja: Hariharan

entertainment.author: Kameshwari
entertainment.content: Gulshan Devaiah was seen teasing Vijay Varma at the trailer launch event of their upcoming project 'Dahaad'. The video shows Devaiah indirectly mentioning Tamannaah Bhatia's name, which left Vijay Varma speechless as well as smiling. The rumours of Tamannaah and Vijay dating each other first hit the internet when they were spotted together at a New Year's party in Goa.
entertainment.title: Gulshan Devaiah teases Vijay Varma about Tamannaah, video surfaces

entertainment.author: Kameshwari
entertainment.content: Shark Tank India's Anupam Mittal recalled watching Ram Gopal Varma's 'Aag' with Amitabh Bachchan and the filmmaker. "I could see Mr Bachchan had absolutely zero expression on his face. I think he knew it [was bad]. But it's okay, it's creative work. Nobody starts out wanting to make...flop," Mittal said in an interview. The 2007 film also starred Mohanlal.
entertainment.title: He had zero expression: Anupam Mittal on watching 'Aag' with Big B
